44
45class Debug::TemporaryObjectsTracker : public HeapObjectAllocationTracker {
46 public:
47 TemporaryObjectsTracker() = default;
48 ~TemporaryObjectsTracker() override = default;
49 TemporaryObjectsTracker(const TemporaryObjectsTracker&) = delete;
50 TemporaryObjectsTracker& operator=(const TemporaryObjectsTracker&) = delete;
51
52 void AllocationEvent(Address addr, int size) override {
53 if (disabled) return;
54 AddRegion(addr, addr + size);
55 }
56
57 void MoveEvent(Address from, Address to, int size) override {
58 if (from == to) return;
59 base::MutexGuard guard(&mutex_);
60 if (RemoveFromRegions(from, from + size)) {
61 // We had the object tracked as temporary, so we will track the
62 // new location as temporary, too.
63 AddRegion(to, to + size);
64 } else {
65 // The object we moved is a non-temporary, so the new location is also
66 // non-temporary. Thus we remove everything we track there (because it
67 // must have become dead).
68 RemoveFromRegions(to, to + size);
69 }
70 }
71
72 bool HasObject(Handle<HeapObject> obj) {
73 if (IsJSObject(*obj) &&
74 Handle<JSObject>::cast(obj)->GetEmbedderFieldCount()) {
75 // Embedder may store any pointers using embedder fields and implements
76 // non trivial logic, e.g. create wrappers lazily and store pointer to
77 // native object inside embedder field. We should consider all objects
78 // with embedder fields as non temporary.
79 return false;
80 }
81 Address addr = obj->address();
82 return HasRegionContainingObject(addr, addr + obj->Size());
83 }
84
85 bool disabled = false;
86
87 private:
88 bool HasRegionContainingObject(Address start, Address end) {
89 // Check if there is a region that contains (overlaps) this object's space.
90 auto it = FindOverlappingRegion(start, end, false);
91 // If there is, we expect the region to contain the entire object.
92 DCHECK_IMPLIES(it != regions_.end(),
93 it->second <= start && end <= it->first);
94 return it != regions_.end();
95 }
96
97 // This function returns any one of the overlapping regions (there might be
98 // multiple). If {include_adjacent} is true, it will also consider regions
99 // that have no overlap but are directly connected.
100 std::map<Address, Address>::iterator FindOverlappingRegion(
101 Address start, Address end, bool include_adjacent) {
102 // Region A = [start, end) overlaps with an existing region [existing_start,
103 // existing_end) iff (start <= existing_end) && (existing_start <= end).
104 // Since we index {regions_} by end address, we can find a candidate that
105 // satisfies the first condition using lower_bound.
106 if (include_adjacent) {
107 auto it = regions_.lower_bound(start);
108 if (it == regions_.end()) return regions_.end();
109 if (it->second <= end) return it;
110 } else {
111 auto it = regions_.upper_bound(start);
112 if (it == regions_.end()) return regions_.end();
113 if (it->second < end) return it;
114 }
115 return regions_.end();
116 }
117
118 void AddRegion(Address start, Address end) {
119 DCHECK_LT(start, end);
120
121 // Region [start, end) can be combined with an existing region if they
122 // overlap.
123 while (true) {
124 auto it = FindOverlappingRegion(start, end, true);
125 // If there is no such region, we don't need to merge anything.
126 if (it == regions_.end()) break;
127
128 // Otherwise, we found an overlapping region. We remove the old one and
129 // add the new region recursively (to handle cases where the new region
130 // overlaps multiple existing ones).
131 start = std::min(start, it->second);
132 end = std::max(end, it->first);
133 regions_.erase(it);
134 }
135
136 // Add the new (possibly combined) region.
137 regions_.emplace(end, start);
138 }
139
140 bool RemoveFromRegions(Address start, Address end) {
141 // Check if we have anything that overlaps with [start, end).
142 auto it = FindOverlappingRegion(start, end, false);
143 if (it == regions_.end()) return false;
144
145 // We need to update all overlapping regions.
146 for (; it != regions_.end();
147 it = FindOverlappingRegion(start, end, false)) {
148 Address existing_start = it->second;
149 Address existing_end = it->first;
150 // If we remove the region [start, end) from an existing region
151 // [existing_start, existing_end), there can be at most 2 regions left:
152 regions_.erase(it);
153 // The one before {start} is: [existing_start, start)
154 if (existing_start < start) AddRegion(existing_start, start);
155 // And the one after {end} is: [end, existing_end)
156 if (end < existing_end) AddRegion(end, existing_end);
157 }
158 return true;
159 }
160
161 // Tracking addresses is not enough, because a single allocation may combine
162 // multiple objects due to allocation folding. We track both start and end
163 // (exclusive) address of regions. We index by end address for faster lookup.
164 // Map: end address => start address
165 std::map<Address, Address> regions_;
166 base::Mutex mutex_;
167};
168
169Debug::Debug(Isolate* isolate)
170 : is_active_(false),
171 hook_on_function_call_(false),
172 is_suppressed_(false),
173 break_disabled_(false),
174 break_points_active_(true),
175 break_on_caught_exception_(false),
176 break_on_uncaught_exception_(false),
177 side_effect_check_failed_(false),
178 debug_infos_(isolate),
179 isolate_(isolate) {
180 ThreadInit();
181}
182
183Debug::~Debug() { DCHECK_NULL(debug_delegate_); }
184
185BreakLocation BreakLocation::FromFrame(Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info,
186 JavaScriptFrame* frame) {
187 if (debug_info->CanBreakAtEntry()) {
188 return BreakLocation(Debug::kBreakAtEntryPosition, DEBUG_BREAK_AT_ENTRY);
189 }
190 auto summary = FrameSummary::GetTop(frame).AsJavaScript();
191 int offset = summary.code_offset();
192 Handle<AbstractCode> abstract_code = summary.abstract_code();
193 BreakIterator it(debug_info);
194 it.SkipTo(BreakIndexFromCodeOffset(debug_info, abstract_code, offset));
195 return it.GetBreakLocation();
196}
197
198bool BreakLocation::IsPausedInJsFunctionEntry(JavaScriptFrame* frame) {
199 auto summary = FrameSummary::GetTop(frame);
200 return summary.code_offset() == kFunctionEntryBytecodeOffset;
201}
202
203MaybeHandle<FixedArray> Debug::CheckBreakPointsForLocations(
204 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info, std::vector<BreakLocation>& break_locations,
205 bool* has_break_points) {
206 Handle<FixedArray> break_points_hit = isolate_->factory()->NewFixedArray(
207 debug_info->GetBreakPointCount(isolate_));
208 int break_points_hit_count = 0;
209 bool has_break_points_at_all = false;
210 for (size_t i = 0; i < break_locations.size(); i++) {
211 bool location_has_break_points;
212 MaybeHandle<FixedArray> check_result = CheckBreakPoints(
213 debug_info, &break_locations[i], &location_has_break_points);
214 has_break_points_at_all |= location_has_break_points;
215 if (!check_result.is_null()) {
216 Handle<FixedArray> break_points_current_hit =
217 check_result.ToHandleChecked();
218 int num_objects = break_points_current_hit->length();
219 for (int j = 0; j < num_objects; ++j) {
220 break_points_hit->set(break_points_hit_count++,
221 break_points_current_hit->get(j));
222 }
223 }
224 }
225 *has_break_points = has_break_points_at_all;
226 if (break_points_hit_count == 0) return {};
227
228 break_points_hit->RightTrim(isolate_, break_points_hit_count);
229 return break_points_hit;
230}
231
232void BreakLocation::AllAtCurrentStatement(
233 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info, JavaScriptFrame* frame,
234 std::vector<BreakLocation>* result_out) {
235 DCHECK(!debug_info->CanBreakAtEntry());
236 auto summary = FrameSummary::GetTop(frame).AsJavaScript();
237 int offset = summary.code_offset();
238 Handle<AbstractCode> abstract_code = summary.abstract_code();
239 PtrComprCageBase cage_base = GetPtrComprCageBase(*debug_info);
240 if (IsCode(*abstract_code, cage_base)) offset = offset - 1;
241 int statement_position;
242 {
243 BreakIterator it(debug_info);
244 it.SkipTo(BreakIndexFromCodeOffset(debug_info, abstract_code, offset));
245 statement_position = it.statement_position();
246 }
247 for (BreakIterator it(debug_info); !it.Done(); it.Next()) {
248 if (it.statement_position() == statement_position) {
249 result_out->push_back(it.GetBreakLocation());
250 }
251 }
252}
253
254Tagged<JSGeneratorObject> BreakLocation::GetGeneratorObjectForSuspendedFrame(
255 JavaScriptFrame* frame) const {
256 DCHECK(IsSuspend());
257 DCHECK_GE(generator_obj_reg_index_, 0);
258
259 Tagged<Object> generator_obj =
260 UnoptimizedFrame::cast(frame)->ReadInterpreterRegister(
261 generator_obj_reg_index_);
262
263 return JSGeneratorObject::cast(generator_obj);
264}
265
266int BreakLocation::BreakIndexFromCodeOffset(Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info,
267 Handle<AbstractCode> abstract_code,
268 int offset) {
269 // Run through all break points to locate the one closest to the address.
270 int closest_break = 0;
271 int distance = kMaxInt;
272 DCHECK(kFunctionEntryBytecodeOffset <= offset &&
273 offset < abstract_code->Size());
274 for (BreakIterator it(debug_info); !it.Done(); it.Next()) {
275 // Check if this break point is closer that what was previously found.
276 if (it.code_offset() <= offset && offset - it.code_offset() < distance) {
277 closest_break = it.break_index();
278 distance = offset - it.code_offset();
279 // Check whether we can't get any closer.
280 if (distance == 0) break;
281 }
282 }
283 return closest_break;
284}
285
286bool BreakLocation::HasBreakPoint(Isolate* isolate,
287 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info) const {
288 // First check whether there is a break point with the same source position.
289 if (!debug_info->HasBreakInfo() ||
290 !debug_info->HasBreakPoint(isolate, position_)) {
291 return false;
292 }
293 if (debug_info->CanBreakAtEntry()) {
294 DCHECK_EQ(Debug::kBreakAtEntryPosition, position_);
295 return debug_info->BreakAtEntry();
296 } else {
297 // Then check whether a break point at that source position would have
298 // the same code offset. Otherwise it's just a break location that we can
299 // step to, but not actually a location where we can put a break point.
300 DCHECK(IsBytecodeArray(*abstract_code_, isolate));
301 BreakIterator it(debug_info);
302 it.SkipToPosition(position_);
303 return it.code_offset() == code_offset_;
304 }
305}
306
307debug::BreakLocationType BreakLocation::type() const {
308 switch (type_) {
309 case DEBUGGER_STATEMENT:
310 return debug::kDebuggerStatementBreakLocation;
311 case DEBUG_BREAK_SLOT_AT_CALL:
312 return debug::kCallBreakLocation;
313 case DEBUG_BREAK_SLOT_AT_RETURN:
314 return debug::kReturnBreakLocation;
315
316 // Externally, suspend breaks should look like normal breaks.
317 case DEBUG_BREAK_SLOT_AT_SUSPEND:
318 default:
319 return debug::kCommonBreakLocation;
320 }
321}
322
323BreakIterator::BreakIterator(Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info)
324 : debug_info_(debug_info),
325 break_index_(-1),
326 source_position_iterator_(
327 debug_info->DebugBytecodeArray(isolate())->SourcePositionTable()) {
328 position_ = debug_info->shared()->StartPosition();
329 statement_position_ = position_;
330 // There is at least one break location.
331 DCHECK(!Done());
332 Next();
333}
334
335int BreakIterator::BreakIndexFromPosition(int source_position) {
336 for (; !Done(); Next()) {
337 if (GetDebugBreakType() == DEBUG_BREAK_SLOT_AT_SUSPEND) continue;
338 if (source_position <= position()) {
339 int first_break = break_index();
340 for (; !Done(); Next()) {
341 if (GetDebugBreakType() == DEBUG_BREAK_SLOT_AT_SUSPEND) continue;
342 if (source_position == position()) return break_index();
343 }
344 return first_break;
345 }
346 }
347 return break_index();
348}
349
350void BreakIterator::Next() {
351 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
352 DCHECK(!Done());
353 bool first = break_index_ == -1;
354 while (!Done()) {
355 if (!first) source_position_iterator_.Advance();
356 first = false;
357 if (Done()) return;
358 position_ = source_position_iterator_.source_position().ScriptOffset();
359 if (source_position_iterator_.is_statement()) {
360 statement_position_ = position_;
361 }
362 DCHECK_LE(0, position_);
363 DCHECK_LE(0, statement_position_);
364
365 DebugBreakType type = GetDebugBreakType();
366 if (type != NOT_DEBUG_BREAK) break;
367 }
368 break_index_++;
369}
370
371DebugBreakType BreakIterator::GetDebugBreakType() {
372 Tagged<BytecodeArray> bytecode_array =
373 debug_info_->OriginalBytecodeArray(isolate());
374 interpreter::Bytecode bytecode =
375 interpreter::Bytecodes::FromByte(bytecode_array->get(code_offset()));
376
377 // Make sure we read the actual bytecode, not a prefix scaling bytecode.
378 if (interpreter::Bytecodes::IsPrefixScalingBytecode(bytecode)) {
379 bytecode = interpreter::Bytecodes::FromByte(
380 bytecode_array->get(code_offset() + 1));
381 }
382
383 if (bytecode == interpreter::Bytecode::kDebugger) {
384 return DEBUGGER_STATEMENT;
385 } else if (bytecode == interpreter::Bytecode::kReturn) {
386 return DEBUG_BREAK_SLOT_AT_RETURN;
387 } else if (bytecode == interpreter::Bytecode::kSuspendGenerator) {
388 // SuspendGenerator should always only carry an expression position that
389 // is used in stack trace construction, but should never be a breakable
390 // position reported to the debugger front-end.
391 DCHECK(!source_position_iterator_.is_statement());
392 return DEBUG_BREAK_SLOT_AT_SUSPEND;
393 } else if (interpreter::Bytecodes::IsCallOrConstruct(bytecode)) {
394 return DEBUG_BREAK_SLOT_AT_CALL;
395 } else if (source_position_iterator_.is_statement()) {
396 return DEBUG_BREAK_SLOT;
397 } else {
398 return NOT_DEBUG_BREAK;
399 }
400}
401
402void BreakIterator::SkipToPosition(int position) {
403 BreakIterator it(debug_info_);
404 SkipTo(it.BreakIndexFromPosition(position));
405}
406
407void BreakIterator::SetDebugBreak() {
408 DebugBreakType debug_break_type = GetDebugBreakType();
409 if (debug_break_type == DEBUGGER_STATEMENT) return;
410 HandleScope scope(isolate());
411 DCHECK(debug_break_type >= DEBUG_BREAK_SLOT);
412 Handle<BytecodeArray> bytecode_array(
413 debug_info_->DebugBytecodeArray(isolate()), isolate());
414 interpreter::BytecodeArrayIterator(bytecode_array, code_offset())
415 .ApplyDebugBreak();
416}
417
418void BreakIterator::ClearDebugBreak() {
419 DebugBreakType debug_break_type = GetDebugBreakType();
420 if (debug_break_type == DEBUGGER_STATEMENT) return;
421 DCHECK(debug_break_type >= DEBUG_BREAK_SLOT);
422 Tagged<BytecodeArray> bytecode_array =
423 debug_info_->DebugBytecodeArray(isolate());
424 Tagged<BytecodeArray> original =
425 debug_info_->OriginalBytecodeArray(isolate());
426 bytecode_array->set(code_offset(), original->get(code_offset()));
427}
428
429BreakLocation BreakIterator::GetBreakLocation() {
430 Handle<AbstractCode> code(
431 AbstractCode::cast(debug_info_->DebugBytecodeArray(isolate())),
432 isolate());
433 DebugBreakType type = GetDebugBreakType();
434 int generator_object_reg_index = -1;
435 int generator_suspend_id = -1;
436 if (type == DEBUG_BREAK_SLOT_AT_SUSPEND) {
437 // For suspend break, we'll need the generator object to be able to step
438 // over the suspend as if it didn't return. We get the interpreter register
439 // index that holds the generator object by reading it directly off the
440 // bytecode array, and we'll read the actual generator object off the
441 // interpreter stack frame in GetGeneratorObjectForSuspendedFrame.
442 Tagged<BytecodeArray> bytecode_array =
443 debug_info_->OriginalBytecodeArray(isolate());
444 interpreter::BytecodeArrayIterator iterator(
445 handle(bytecode_array, isolate()), code_offset());
446
447 DCHECK_EQ(iterator.current_bytecode(),
448 interpreter::Bytecode::kSuspendGenerator);
449 interpreter::Register generator_obj_reg = iterator.GetRegisterOperand(0);
450 generator_object_reg_index = generator_obj_reg.index();
451
452 // Also memorize the suspend ID, to be able to decide whether
453 // we are paused on the implicit initial yield later.
454 generator_suspend_id = iterator.GetUnsignedImmediateOperand(3);
455 }
456 return BreakLocation(code, type, code_offset(), position_,
457 generator_object_reg_index, generator_suspend_id);
458}
459
460Isolate* BreakIterator::isolate() { return debug_info_->GetIsolate(); }
461
462// Threading support.
463void Debug::ThreadInit() {
464 thread_local_.break_frame_id_ = StackFrameId::NO_ID;
465 thread_local_.last_step_action_ = StepNone;
466 thread_local_.last_statement_position_ = kNoSourcePosition;
467 thread_local_.last_bytecode_offset_ = kFunctionEntryBytecodeOffset;
468 thread_local_.last_frame_count_ = -1;
469 thread_local_.fast_forward_to_return_ = false;
470 thread_local_.ignore_step_into_function_ = Smi::zero();
471 thread_local_.target_frame_count_ = -1;
472 thread_local_.return_value_ = Smi::zero();
473 thread_local_.last_breakpoint_id_ = 0;
474 clear_restart_frame();
475 clear_suspended_generator();
476 base::Relaxed_Store(&thread_local_.current_debug_scope_,
477 static_cast<base::AtomicWord>(0));
478 thread_local_.break_on_next_function_call_ = false;
479 thread_local_.scheduled_break_on_next_function_call_ = false;
480 UpdateHookOnFunctionCall();
481}
482
483char* Debug::ArchiveDebug(char* storage) {
484 MemCopy(storage, reinterpret_cast<char*>(&thread_local_),
485 ArchiveSpacePerThread());
486 return storage + ArchiveSpacePerThread();
487}
488
489char* Debug::RestoreDebug(char* storage) {
490 MemCopy(reinterpret_cast<char*>(&thread_local_), storage,
491 ArchiveSpacePerThread());
492
493 // Enter the isolate.
494 v8::Isolate::Scope isolate_scope(reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(isolate_));
495 // Enter the debugger.
496 DebugScope debug_scope(this);
497
498 // Clear any one-shot breakpoints that may have been set by the other
499 // thread, and reapply breakpoints for this thread.
500 ClearOneShot();
501
502 if (thread_local_.last_step_action_ != StepNone) {
503 int current_frame_count = CurrentFrameCount();
504 int target_frame_count = thread_local_.target_frame_count_;
505 DCHECK(current_frame_count >= target_frame_count);
506 DebuggableStackFrameIterator frames_it(isolate_);
507 while (current_frame_count > target_frame_count) {
508 current_frame_count -= frames_it.FrameFunctionCount();
509 frames_it.Advance();
510 }
511 DCHECK(current_frame_count == target_frame_count);
512 // Set frame to what it was at Step break
513 thread_local_.break_frame_id_ = frames_it.frame()->id();
514
515 // Reset the previous step action for this thread.
516 PrepareStep(thread_local_.last_step_action_);
517 }
518
519 return storage + ArchiveSpacePerThread();
520}
521
522int Debug::ArchiveSpacePerThread() { return sizeof(ThreadLocal); }
523
524void Debug::Iterate(RootVisitor* v) { Iterate(v, &thread_local_); }
525
526char* Debug::Iterate(RootVisitor* v, char* thread_storage) {
527 ThreadLocal* thread_local_data =
528 reinterpret_cast<ThreadLocal*>(thread_storage);
529 Iterate(v, thread_local_data);
530 return thread_storage + ArchiveSpacePerThread();
531}
532
533void Debug::Iterate(RootVisitor* v, ThreadLocal* thread_local_data) {
534 v->VisitRootPointer(Root::kDebug, nullptr,
535 FullObjectSlot(&thread_local_data->return_value_));
536 v->VisitRootPointer(Root::kDebug, nullptr,
537 FullObjectSlot(&thread_local_data->suspended_generator_));
538 v->VisitRootPointer(
539 Root::kDebug, nullptr,
540 FullObjectSlot(&thread_local_data->ignore_step_into_function_));
541}
542
543void DebugInfoCollection::Insert(Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> sfi,
544 Tagged<DebugInfo> debug_info) {
545 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
546 base::SharedMutexGuard<base::kExclusive> mutex_guard(
547 isolate_->shared_function_info_access());
548
549 DCHECK_EQ(sfi, debug_info->shared());
550 DCHECK(!Contains(sfi));
551 HandleLocation location =
552 isolate_->global_handles()->Create(debug_info).location();
553 list_.push_back(location);
554 map_.emplace(sfi->unique_id(), location);
555 DCHECK(Contains(sfi));
556 DCHECK_EQ(list_.size(), map_.size());
557}
558
559bool DebugInfoCollection::Contains(Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> sfi) const {
560 auto it = map_.find(sfi->unique_id());
561 if (it == map_.end()) return false;
562 DCHECK_EQ(DebugInfo::cast(Tagged<Object>(*it->second))->shared(), sfi);
563 return true;
564}
565
566base::Optional<Tagged<DebugInfo>> DebugInfoCollection::Find(
567 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> sfi) const {
568 auto it = map_.find(sfi->unique_id());
569 if (it == map_.end()) return {};
570 Tagged<DebugInfo> di = DebugInfo::cast(Tagged<Object>(*it->second));
571 DCHECK_EQ(di->shared(), sfi);
572 return di;
573}
574
575void DebugInfoCollection::DeleteSlow(Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> sfi) {
576 DebugInfoCollection::Iterator it(this);
577 for (; it.HasNext(); it.Advance()) {
578 Tagged<DebugInfo> debug_info = it.Next();
579 if (debug_info->shared() != sfi) continue;
580 it.DeleteNext();
581 return;
582 }
583 UNREACHABLE();
584}
585
586Tagged<DebugInfo> DebugInfoCollection::EntryAsDebugInfo(size_t index) const {
587 DCHECK_LT(index, list_.size());
588 return DebugInfo::cast(Tagged<Object>(*list_[index]));
589}
590
591void DebugInfoCollection::DeleteIndex(size_t index) {
592 base::SharedMutexGuard<base::kExclusive> mutex_guard(
593 isolate_->shared_function_info_access());
594
595 Tagged<DebugInfo> debug_info = EntryAsDebugInfo(index);
596 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> sfi = debug_info->shared();
597 DCHECK(Contains(sfi));
598
599 auto it = map_.find(sfi->unique_id());
600 HandleLocation location = it->second;
601 DCHECK_EQ(location, list_[index]);
602 map_.erase(it);
603
604 list_[index] = list_.back();
605 list_.pop_back();
606
607 GlobalHandles::Destroy(location);
608 DCHECK(!Contains(sfi));
609 DCHECK_EQ(list_.size(), map_.size());
610}
611
612void Debug::Unload() {
613 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
614 ClearAllBreakPoints();
615 ClearStepping();
616 RemoveAllCoverageInfos();
617 ClearAllDebuggerHints();
618 debug_delegate_ = nullptr;
619}
620
621debug::DebugDelegate::ActionAfterInstrumentation
622Debug::OnInstrumentationBreak() {
623 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
624 if (!debug_delegate_) {
625 return debug::DebugDelegate::ActionAfterInstrumentation::
626 kPauseIfBreakpointsHit;
627 }
628 DCHECK(in_debug_scope());
629 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
630 DisableBreak no_recursive_break(this);
631
632 return debug_delegate_->BreakOnInstrumentation(
633 v8::Utils::ToLocal(isolate_->native_context()), kInstrumentationId);
634}
635
636void Debug::Break(JavaScriptFrame* frame, Handle<JSFunction> break_target) {
637 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
638 // Just continue if breaks are disabled or debugger cannot be loaded.
639 if (break_disabled()) return;
640
641 // Enter the debugger.
642 DebugScope debug_scope(this);
643 DisableBreak no_recursive_break(this);
644
645 // Return if we fail to retrieve debug info.
646 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared(break_target->shared(), isolate_);
647 if (!EnsureBreakInfo(shared)) return;
648 PrepareFunctionForDebugExecution(shared);
649
650 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info(TryGetDebugInfo(*shared).value(), isolate_);
651
652 // Find the break location where execution has stopped.
653 BreakLocation location = BreakLocation::FromFrame(debug_info, frame);
654 const bool hitInstrumentationBreak =
655 IsBreakOnInstrumentation(debug_info, location);
656 bool shouldPauseAfterInstrumentation = false;
657 if (hitInstrumentationBreak) {
658 debug::DebugDelegate::ActionAfterInstrumentation action =
659 OnInstrumentationBreak();
660 switch (action) {
661 case debug::DebugDelegate::ActionAfterInstrumentation::kPause:
662 shouldPauseAfterInstrumentation = true;
663 break;
664 case debug::DebugDelegate::ActionAfterInstrumentation::
665 kPauseIfBreakpointsHit:
666 shouldPauseAfterInstrumentation = false;
667 break;
668 case debug::DebugDelegate::ActionAfterInstrumentation::kContinue:
669 return;
670 }
671 }
672
673 // Find actual break points, if any, and trigger debug break event.
674 bool has_break_points;
675 bool scheduled_break =
676 scheduled_break_on_function_call() || shouldPauseAfterInstrumentation;
677 MaybeHandle<FixedArray> break_points_hit =
678 CheckBreakPoints(debug_info, &location, &has_break_points);
679 if (!break_points_hit.is_null() || break_on_next_function_call() ||
680 scheduled_break) {
681 StepAction lastStepAction = last_step_action();
682 debug::BreakReasons break_reasons;
683 if (scheduled_break) {
684 break_reasons.Add(debug::BreakReason::kScheduled);
685 }
686 // Clear all current stepping setup.
687 ClearStepping();
688 // Notify the debug event listeners.
689 OnDebugBreak(!break_points_hit.is_null()
690 ? break_points_hit.ToHandleChecked()
691 : isolate_->factory()->empty_fixed_array(),
692 lastStepAction, break_reasons);
693 return;
694 }
695
696 // Debug break at function entry, do not worry about stepping.
697 if (location.IsDebugBreakAtEntry()) {
698 DCHECK(debug_info->BreakAtEntry());
699 return;
700 }
701
702 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(frame);
703
704 // No break point. Check for stepping.
705 StepAction step_action = last_step_action();
706 int current_frame_count = CurrentFrameCount();
707 int target_frame_count = thread_local_.target_frame_count_;
708 int last_frame_count = thread_local_.last_frame_count_;
709
710 // StepOut at not return position was requested and return break locations
711 // were flooded with one shots.
712 if (thread_local_.fast_forward_to_return_) {
713 // We might hit an instrumentation breakpoint before running into a
714 // return/suspend location.
715 DCHECK(location.IsReturnOrSuspend() || hitInstrumentationBreak);
716 // We have to ignore recursive calls to function.
717 if (current_frame_count > target_frame_count) return;
718 ClearStepping();
719 PrepareStep(StepOut);
720 return;
721 }
722
723 bool step_break = false;
724 switch (step_action) {
725 case StepNone:
726 return;
727 case StepOut:
728 // StepOut should not break in a deeper frame than target frame.
729 if (current_frame_count > target_frame_count) return;
730 step_break = true;
731 break;
732 case StepOver:
733 // StepOver should not break in a deeper frame than target frame.
734 if (current_frame_count > target_frame_count) return;
735 [[fallthrough]];
736 case StepInto: {
737 // StepInto and StepOver should enter "generator stepping" mode, except
738 // for the implicit initial yield in generators, where it should simply
739 // step out of the generator function.
740 if (location.IsSuspend()) {
741 DCHECK(!has_suspended_generator());
742 ClearStepping();
743 if (!IsGeneratorFunction(shared->kind()) ||
744 location.generator_suspend_id() > 0) {
745 thread_local_.suspended_generator_ =
746 location.GetGeneratorObjectForSuspendedFrame(frame);
747 } else {
748 PrepareStep(StepOut);
749 }
750 return;
751 }
752 FrameSummary summary = FrameSummary::GetTop(frame);
753 const bool frame_or_statement_changed =
754 current_frame_count != last_frame_count ||
755 thread_local_.last_statement_position_ !=
756 summary.SourceStatementPosition();
757 // If we stayed on the same frame and reached the same bytecode offset
758 // since the last step, we are in a loop and should pause. Otherwise
759 // we keep "stepping" through the loop without ever acutally pausing.
760 const bool potential_single_statement_loop =
761 current_frame_count == last_frame_count &&
762 thread_local_.last_bytecode_offset_ == summary.code_offset();
763 step_break = step_break || location.IsReturn() ||
764 potential_single_statement_loop ||
765 frame_or_statement_changed;
766 break;
767 }
768 }
769
770 StepAction lastStepAction = last_step_action();
771 // Clear all current stepping setup.
772 ClearStepping();
773
774 if (step_break) {
775 // Notify the debug event listeners.
776 OnDebugBreak(isolate_->factory()->empty_fixed_array(), lastStepAction);
777 } else {
778 // Re-prepare to continue.
779 PrepareStep(step_action);
780 }
781}
782
783bool Debug::IsBreakOnInstrumentation(Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info,
784 const BreakLocation& location) {
785 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
786 bool has_break_points_to_check =
787 break_points_active_ && location.HasBreakPoint(isolate_, debug_info);
788 if (!has_break_points_to_check) return {};
789
790 Handle<Object> break_points =
791 debug_info->GetBreakPoints(isolate_, location.position());
792 DCHECK(!IsUndefined(*break_points, isolate_));
793 if (!IsFixedArray(*break_points)) {
794 const Handle<BreakPoint> break_point =
795 Handle<BreakPoint>::cast(break_points);
796 return break_point->id() == kInstrumentationId;
797 }
798
799 Handle<FixedArray> array(FixedArray::cast(*break_points), isolate_);
800 for (int i = 0; i < array->length(); ++i) {
801 const Handle<BreakPoint> break_point =
802 Handle<BreakPoint>::cast(handle(array->get(i), isolate_));
803 if (break_point->id() == kInstrumentationId) {
804 return true;
805 }
806 }
807 return false;
808}
809
810// Find break point objects for this location, if any, and evaluate them.
811// Return an array of break point objects that evaluated true, or an empty
812// handle if none evaluated true.
813// has_break_points will be true, if there is any (non-instrumentation)
814// breakpoint.
815MaybeHandle<FixedArray> Debug::CheckBreakPoints(Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info,
816 BreakLocation* location,
817 bool* has_break_points) {
818 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
819 bool has_break_points_to_check =
820 break_points_active_ && location->HasBreakPoint(isolate_, debug_info);
821 if (!has_break_points_to_check) {
822 *has_break_points = false;
823 return {};
824 }
825
826 return Debug::GetHitBreakPoints(debug_info, location->position(),
827 has_break_points);
828}
829
830bool Debug::IsMutedAtCurrentLocation(JavaScriptFrame* frame) {
831 // A break location is considered muted if break locations on the current
832 // statement have at least one break point, and all of these break points
833 // evaluate to false. Aside from not triggering a debug break event at the
834 // break location, we also do not trigger one for debugger statements, nor
835 // an exception event on exception at this location.
836 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
837 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
838 bool has_break_points;
839 MaybeHandle<FixedArray> checked =
840 GetHitBreakpointsAtCurrentStatement(frame, &has_break_points);
841 return has_break_points && checked.is_null();
842}
843
844namespace {
845
846// Convenience helper for easier base::Optional translation.
847bool ToHandle(Isolate* isolate, base::Optional<Tagged<DebugInfo>> debug_info,
848 Handle<DebugInfo>* out) {
849 if (!debug_info.has_value()) return false;
850 *out = handle(debug_info.value(), isolate);
851 return true;
852}
853
854} // namespace
855
856MaybeHandle<FixedArray> Debug::GetHitBreakpointsAtCurrentStatement(
857 JavaScriptFrame* frame, bool* has_break_points) {
858 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
859 FrameSummary summary = FrameSummary::GetTop(frame);
860 Handle<JSFunction> function = summary.AsJavaScript().function();
861 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info;
862 if (!ToHandle(isolate_, TryGetDebugInfo(function->shared()), &debug_info) ||
863 !debug_info->HasBreakInfo()) {
864 *has_break_points = false;
865 return {};
866 }
867 // Enter the debugger.
868 DebugScope debug_scope(this);
869 std::vector<BreakLocation> break_locations;
870 BreakLocation::AllAtCurrentStatement(debug_info, frame, &break_locations);
871 return CheckBreakPointsForLocations(debug_info, break_locations,
872 has_break_points);
873}
874
875// Check whether a single break point object is triggered.
876bool Debug::CheckBreakPoint(Handle<BreakPoint> break_point,
877 bool is_break_at_entry) {
878 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
879 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
880
881 // Instrumentation breakpoints are handled separately.
882 if (break_point->id() == kInstrumentationId) {
883 return false;
884 }
885
886 if (!break_point->condition()->length()) return true;
887 Handle<String> condition(break_point->condition(), isolate_);
888 MaybeHandle<Object> maybe_result;
889 Handle<Object> result;
890
891 if (is_break_at_entry) {
892 maybe_result = DebugEvaluate::WithTopmostArguments(isolate_, condition);
893 } else {
894 // Since we call CheckBreakpoint only for deoptimized frame on top of stack,
895 // we can use 0 as index of inlined frame.
896 const int inlined_jsframe_index = 0;
897 const bool throw_on_side_effect = false;
898 maybe_result =
899 DebugEvaluate::Local(isolate_, break_frame_id(), inlined_jsframe_index,
900 condition, throw_on_side_effect);
901 }
902
903 Handle<Object> maybe_exception;
904 bool exception_thrown = true;
905 if (maybe_result.ToHandle(&result)) {
906 exception_thrown = false;
907 } else if (isolate_->has_exception()) {
908 maybe_exception = handle(isolate_->exception(), isolate_);
909 isolate_->clear_exception();
910 }
911
912 CHECK(in_debug_scope());
913 DisableBreak no_recursive_break(this);
914
915 {
916 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebuggerCallback);
917 debug_delegate_->BreakpointConditionEvaluated(
918 v8::Utils::ToLocal(isolate_->native_context()), break_point->id(),
919 exception_thrown, v8::Utils::ToLocal(maybe_exception));
920 }
921
922 return !result.is_null() ? Object::BooleanValue(*result, isolate_) : false;
923}
924
925bool Debug::SetBreakpoint(Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared,
926 Handle<BreakPoint> break_point,
927 int* source_position) {
928 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
929 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
930
931 // Make sure the function is compiled and has set up the debug info.
932 if (!EnsureBreakInfo(shared)) return false;
933 PrepareFunctionForDebugExecution(shared);
934
935 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info(TryGetDebugInfo(*shared).value(), isolate_);
936 // Source positions starts with zero.
937 DCHECK_LE(0, *source_position);
938
939 // Find the break point and change it.
940 *source_position = FindBreakablePosition(debug_info, *source_position);
941 DebugInfo::SetBreakPoint(isolate_, debug_info, *source_position, break_point);
942 // At least one active break point now.
943 DCHECK_LT(0, debug_info->GetBreakPointCount(isolate_));
944
945 ClearBreakPoints(debug_info);
946 ApplyBreakPoints(debug_info);
947 return true;
948}
949
950bool Debug::SetBreakPointForScript(Handle<Script> script,
951 Handle<String> condition,
952 int* source_position, int* id) {
953 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
954 *id = ++thread_local_.last_breakpoint_id_;
955 Handle<BreakPoint> break_point =
956 isolate_->factory()->NewBreakPoint(*id, condition);
957#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
958 if (script->type() == Script::Type::kWasm) {
959 RecordWasmScriptWithBreakpoints(script);
960 return WasmScript::SetBreakPoint(script, source_position, break_point);
961 }
962#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
963
964 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
965
966 // Obtain shared function info for the innermost function containing this
967 // position.
968 Handle<Object> result =
969 FindInnermostContainingFunctionInfo(script, *source_position);
970 if (IsUndefined(*result, isolate_)) return false;
971
972 auto shared = Handle<SharedFunctionInfo>::cast(result);
973 if (!EnsureBreakInfo(shared)) return false;
974 PrepareFunctionForDebugExecution(shared);
975
976 // Find the nested shared function info that is closest to the position within
977 // the containing function.
978 shared = FindClosestSharedFunctionInfoFromPosition(*source_position, script,
979 shared);
980
981 // Set the breakpoint in the function.
982 return SetBreakpoint(shared, break_point, source_position);
983}
984
985int Debug::FindBreakablePosition(Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info,
986 int source_position) {
987 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
988 if (debug_info->CanBreakAtEntry()) {
989 return kBreakAtEntryPosition;
990 } else {
991 DCHECK(debug_info->HasInstrumentedBytecodeArray());
992 BreakIterator it(debug_info);
993 it.SkipToPosition(source_position);
994 return it.position();
995 }
996}
997
998void Debug::ApplyBreakPoints(Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info) {
999 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1000 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
1001 if (debug_info->CanBreakAtEntry()) {
1002 debug_info->SetBreakAtEntry();
1003 } else {
1004 if (!debug_info->HasInstrumentedBytecodeArray()) return;
1005 Tagged<FixedArray> break_points = debug_info->break_points();
1006 for (int i = 0; i < break_points->length(); i++) {
1007 if (IsUndefined(break_points->get(i), isolate_)) continue;
1008 Tagged<BreakPointInfo> info = BreakPointInfo::cast(break_points->get(i));
1009 if (info->GetBreakPointCount(isolate_) == 0) continue;
1010 DCHECK(debug_info->HasInstrumentedBytecodeArray());
1011 BreakIterator it(debug_info);
1012 it.SkipToPosition(info->source_position());
1013 it.SetDebugBreak();
1014 }
1015 }
1016 debug_info->SetDebugExecutionMode(DebugInfo::kBreakpoints);
1017}
1018
1019void Debug::ClearBreakPoints(Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info) {
1020 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1021 if (debug_info->CanBreakAtEntry()) {
1022 debug_info->ClearBreakAtEntry();
1023 } else {
1024 // If we attempt to clear breakpoints but none exist, simply return. This
1025 // can happen e.g. CoverageInfos exist but no breakpoints are set.
1026 if (!debug_info->HasInstrumentedBytecodeArray() ||
1027 !debug_info->HasBreakInfo()) {
1028 return;
1029 }
1030
1031 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
1032 for (BreakIterator it(debug_info); !it.Done(); it.Next()) {
1033 it.ClearDebugBreak();
1034 }
1035 }
1036}
1037
1038void Debug::ClearBreakPoint(Handle<BreakPoint> break_point) {
1039 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1040 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
1041
1042 DebugInfoCollection::Iterator it(&debug_infos_);
1043 for (; it.HasNext(); it.Advance()) {
1044 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info(it.Next(), isolate_);
1045 if (!debug_info->HasBreakInfo()) continue;
1046
1047 Handle<Object> result =
1048 DebugInfo::FindBreakPointInfo(isolate_, debug_info, break_point);
1049 if (IsUndefined(*result, isolate_)) continue;
1050
1051 if (DebugInfo::ClearBreakPoint(isolate_, debug_info, break_point)) {
1052 ClearBreakPoints(debug_info);
1053 if (debug_info->GetBreakPointCount(isolate_) == 0) {
1054 debug_info->ClearBreakInfo(isolate_);
1055 if (debug_info->IsEmpty()) it.DeleteNext();
1056 } else {
1057 ApplyBreakPoints(debug_info);
1058 }
1059 return;
1060 }
1061 }
1062}
1063
1064int Debug::GetFunctionDebuggingId(Handle<JSFunction> function) {
1065 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1066 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared = handle(function->shared(), isolate_);
1067 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info = GetOrCreateDebugInfo(shared);
1068 int id = debug_info->debugging_id();
1069 if (id == DebugInfo::kNoDebuggingId) {
1070 id = isolate_->heap()->NextDebuggingId();
1071 debug_info->set_debugging_id(id);
1072 }
1073 return id;
1074}
1075
1076bool Debug::SetBreakpointForFunction(Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared,
1077 Handle<String> condition, int* id,
1078 BreakPointKind kind) {
1079 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1080 if (kind == kInstrumentation) {
1081 *id = kInstrumentationId;
1082 } else {
1083 *id = ++thread_local_.last_breakpoint_id_;
1084 }
1085 Handle<BreakPoint> breakpoint =
1086 isolate_->factory()->NewBreakPoint(*id, condition);
1087 int source_position = 0;
1088#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1089 // Handle wasm function.
1090 if (shared->HasWasmExportedFunctionData()) {
1091 int func_index = shared->wasm_exported_function_data()->function_index();
1092 Handle<WasmInstanceObject> wasm_instance(
1093 shared->wasm_exported_function_data()->instance(), isolate_);
1094 Handle<Script> script(
1095 Script::cast(wasm_instance->module_object()->script()), isolate_);
1096 return WasmScript::SetBreakPointOnFirstBreakableForFunction(
1097 script, func_index, breakpoint);
1098 }
1099#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1100 return SetBreakpoint(shared, breakpoint, &source_position);
1101}
1102
1103void Debug::RemoveBreakpoint(int id) {
1104 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1105 Handle<BreakPoint> breakpoint = isolate_->factory()->NewBreakPoint(
1106 id, isolate_->factory()->empty_string());
1107 ClearBreakPoint(breakpoint);
1108}
1109
1110#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1111void Debug::SetInstrumentationBreakpointForWasmScript(Handle<Script> script,
1112 int* id) {
1113 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1114 DCHECK_EQ(Script::Type::kWasm, script->type());
1115 *id = kInstrumentationId;
1116
1117 Handle<BreakPoint> break_point = isolate_->factory()->NewBreakPoint(
1118 *id, isolate_->factory()->empty_string());
1119 RecordWasmScriptWithBreakpoints(script);
1120 WasmScript::SetInstrumentationBreakpoint(script, break_point);
1121}
1122
1123void Debug::RemoveBreakpointForWasmScript(Handle<Script> script, int id) {
1124 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1125 if (script->type() == Script::Type::kWasm) {
1126 WasmScript::ClearBreakPointById(script, id);
1127 }
1128}
1129
1130void Debug::RecordWasmScriptWithBreakpoints(Handle<Script> script) {
1131 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1132 if (wasm_scripts_with_break_points_.is_null()) {
1133 Handle<WeakArrayList> new_list = isolate_->factory()->NewWeakArrayList(4);
1134 wasm_scripts_with_break_points_ =
1135 isolate_->global_handles()->Create(*new_list);
1136 }
1137 {
1138 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
1139 for (int idx = wasm_scripts_with_break_points_->length() - 1; idx >= 0;
1140 --idx) {
1141 Tagged<HeapObject> wasm_script;
1142 if (wasm_scripts_with_break_points_->Get(idx).GetHeapObject(
1143 &wasm_script) &&
1144 wasm_script == *script) {
1145 return;
1146 }
1147 }
1148 }
1149 Handle<WeakArrayList> new_list = WeakArrayList::Append(
1150 isolate_, wasm_scripts_with_break_points_, MaybeObjectHandle{script});
1151 if (*new_list != *wasm_scripts_with_break_points_) {
1152 isolate_->global_handles()->Destroy(
1153 wasm_scripts_with_break_points_.location());
1154 wasm_scripts_with_break_points_ =
1155 isolate_->global_handles()->Create(*new_list);
1156 }
1157}
1158#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1159
1160// Clear out all the debug break code.
1161void Debug::ClearAllBreakPoints() {
1162 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1163 ClearAllDebugInfos([=](Handle<DebugInfo> info) {
1164 ClearBreakPoints(info);
1165 info->ClearBreakInfo(isolate_);
1166 });
1167#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1168 // Clear all wasm breakpoints.
1169 if (!wasm_scripts_with_break_points_.is_null()) {
1170 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
1171 for (int idx = wasm_scripts_with_break_points_->length() - 1; idx >= 0;
1172 --idx) {
1173 Tagged<HeapObject> raw_wasm_script;
1174 if (wasm_scripts_with_break_points_->Get(idx).GetHeapObject(
1175 &raw_wasm_script)) {
1176 Tagged<Script> wasm_script = Script::cast(raw_wasm_script);
1177 WasmScript::ClearAllBreakpoints(wasm_script);
1178 wasm_script->wasm_native_module()->GetDebugInfo()->RemoveIsolate(
1179 isolate_);
1180 }
1181 }
1182 wasm_scripts_with_break_points_ = Handle<WeakArrayList>{};
1183 }
1184#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1185}
1186
1187void Debug::FloodWithOneShot(Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared,
1188 bool returns_only) {
1189 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1190 if (IsBlackboxed(shared)) return;
1191 // Make sure the function is compiled and has set up the debug info.
1192 if (!EnsureBreakInfo(shared)) return;
1193 PrepareFunctionForDebugExecution(shared);
1194
1195 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info(TryGetDebugInfo(*shared).value(), isolate_);
1196 // Flood the function with break points.
1197 DCHECK(debug_info->HasInstrumentedBytecodeArray());
1198 for (BreakIterator it(debug_info); !it.Done(); it.Next()) {
1199 if (returns_only && !it.GetBreakLocation().IsReturnOrSuspend()) continue;
1200 it.SetDebugBreak();
1201 }
1202}
1203
1204void Debug::ChangeBreakOnException(ExceptionBreakType type, bool enable) {
1205 if (type == BreakUncaughtException) {
1206 break_on_uncaught_exception_ = enable;
1207 } else {
1208 break_on_caught_exception_ = enable;
1209 }
1210}
1211
1212bool Debug::IsBreakOnException(ExceptionBreakType type) {
1213 if (type == BreakUncaughtException) {
1214 return break_on_uncaught_exception_;
1215 } else {
1216 return break_on_caught_exception_;
1217 }
1218}
1219
1220MaybeHandle<FixedArray> Debug::GetHitBreakPoints(Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info,
1221 int position,
1222 bool* has_break_points) {
1223 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1224 Handle<Object> break_points = debug_info->GetBreakPoints(isolate_, position);
1225 bool is_break_at_entry = debug_info->BreakAtEntry();
1226 DCHECK(!IsUndefined(*break_points, isolate_));
1227 if (!IsFixedArray(*break_points)) {
1228 const Handle<BreakPoint> break_point =
1229 Handle<BreakPoint>::cast(break_points);
1230 *has_break_points = break_point->id() != kInstrumentationId;
1231 if (!CheckBreakPoint(break_point, is_break_at_entry)) {
1232 return {};
1233 }
1234 Handle<FixedArray> break_points_hit = isolate_->factory()->NewFixedArray(1);
1235 break_points_hit->set(0, *break_points);
1236 return break_points_hit;
1237 }
1238
1239 Handle<FixedArray> array(FixedArray::cast(*break_points), isolate_);
1240 int num_objects = array->length();
1241 Handle<FixedArray> break_points_hit =
1242 isolate_->factory()->NewFixedArray(num_objects);
1243 int break_points_hit_count = 0;
1244 *has_break_points = false;
1245 for (int i = 0; i < num_objects; ++i) {
1246 Handle<BreakPoint> break_point =
1247 Handle<BreakPoint>::cast(handle(array->get(i), isolate_));
1248 *has_break_points |= break_point->id() != kInstrumentationId;
1249 if (CheckBreakPoint(break_point, is_break_at_entry)) {
1250 break_points_hit->set(break_points_hit_count++, *break_point);
1251 }
1252 }
1253 if (break_points_hit_count == 0) return {};
1254 break_points_hit->RightTrim(isolate_, break_points_hit_count);
1255 return break_points_hit;
1256}
1257
1258void Debug::SetBreakOnNextFunctionCall() {
1259 // This method forces V8 to break on next function call regardless current
1260 // last_step_action_. If any break happens between SetBreakOnNextFunctionCall
1261 // and ClearBreakOnNextFunctionCall, we will clear this flag and stepping. If
1262 // break does not happen, e.g. all called functions are blackboxed or no
1263 // function is called, then we will clear this flag and let stepping continue
1264 // its normal business.
1265 thread_local_.break_on_next_function_call_ = true;
1266 UpdateHookOnFunctionCall();
1267}
1268
1269void Debug::ClearBreakOnNextFunctionCall() {
1270 thread_local_.break_on_next_function_call_ = false;
1271 UpdateHookOnFunctionCall();
1272}
1273
1274void Debug::PrepareStepIn(Handle<JSFunction> function) {
1275 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1276 CHECK(last_step_action() >= StepInto || break_on_next_function_call() ||
1277 scheduled_break_on_function_call());
1278 if (ignore_events()) return;
1279 if (in_debug_scope()) return;
1280 if (break_disabled()) return;
1281 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared(function->shared(), isolate_);
1282 if (IsBlackboxed(shared)) return;
1283 if (*function == thread_local_.ignore_step_into_function_) return;
1284 thread_local_.ignore_step_into_function_ = Smi::zero();
1285 FloodWithOneShot(shared);
1286}
1287
1288void Debug::PrepareStepInSuspendedGenerator() {
1289 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1290 CHECK(has_suspended_generator());
1291 if (ignore_events()) return;
1292 if (in_debug_scope()) return;
1293 if (break_disabled()) return;
1294 thread_local_.last_step_action_ = StepInto;
1295 UpdateHookOnFunctionCall();
1296 Handle<JSFunction> function(
1297 JSGeneratorObject::cast(thread_local_.suspended_generator_)->function(),
1298 isolate_);
1299 FloodWithOneShot(Handle<SharedFunctionInfo>(function->shared(), isolate_));
1300 clear_suspended_generator();
1301}
1302
1303void Debug::PrepareStepOnThrow() {
1304 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1305 if (last_step_action() == StepNone) return;
1306 if (ignore_events()) return;
1307 if (in_debug_scope()) return;
1308 if (break_disabled()) return;
1309
1310 ClearOneShot();
1311
1312 int current_frame_count = CurrentFrameCount();
1313
1314 // Iterate through the JavaScript stack looking for handlers.
1315 JavaScriptStackFrameIterator it(isolate_);
1316 while (!it.done()) {
1317 JavaScriptFrame* frame = it.frame();
1318 if (frame->LookupExceptionHandlerInTable(nullptr, nullptr) > 0) break;
1319 std::vector<Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo>> infos;
1320 frame->GetFunctions(&infos);
1321 current_frame_count -= infos.size();
1322 it.Advance();
1323 }
1324
1325 // No handler found. Nothing to instrument.
1326 if (it.done()) return;
1327
1328 bool found_handler = false;
1329 // Iterate frames, including inlined frames. First, find the handler frame.
1330 // Then skip to the frame we want to break in, then instrument for stepping.
1331 for (; !it.done(); it.Advance()) {
1332 JavaScriptFrame* frame = JavaScriptFrame::cast(it.frame());
1333 if (last_step_action() == StepInto) {
1334 // Deoptimize frame to ensure calls are checked for step-in.
1335 Deoptimizer::DeoptimizeFunction(frame->function());
1336 }
1337 std::vector<FrameSummary> summaries;
1338 frame->Summarize(&summaries);
1339 for (size_t i = summaries.size(); i != 0; i--, current_frame_count--) {
1340 const FrameSummary& summary = summaries[i - 1];
1341 if (!found_handler) {
1342 // We have yet to find the handler. If the frame inlines multiple
1343 // functions, we have to check each one for the handler.
1344 // If it only contains one function, we already found the handler.
1345 if (summaries.size() > 1) {
1346 Handle<AbstractCode> code = summary.AsJavaScript().abstract_code();
1347 CHECK_EQ(CodeKind::INTERPRETED_FUNCTION, code->kind(isolate_));
1348 HandlerTable table(code->GetBytecodeArray());
1349 int code_offset = summary.code_offset();
1350 found_handler = table.LookupHandlerIndexForRange(code_offset) !=
1351 HandlerTable::kNoHandlerFound;
1352 } else {
1353 found_handler = true;
1354 }
1355 }
1356
1357 if (found_handler) {
1358 // We found the handler. If we are stepping next or out, we need to
1359 // iterate until we found the suitable target frame to break in.
1360 if ((last_step_action() == StepOver || last_step_action() == StepOut) &&
1361 current_frame_count > thread_local_.target_frame_count_) {
1362 continue;
1363 }
1364 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> info(
1365 summary.AsJavaScript().function()->shared(), isolate_);
1366 if (IsBlackboxed(info)) continue;
1367 FloodWithOneShot(info);
1368 return;
1369 }
1370 }
1371 }
1372}
1373
1374void Debug::PrepareStep(StepAction step_action) {
1375 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1376 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
1377
1378 DCHECK(in_debug_scope());
1379
1380 // Get the frame where the execution has stopped and skip the debug frame if
1381 // any. The debug frame will only be present if execution was stopped due to
1382 // hitting a break point. In other situations (e.g. unhandled exception) the
1383 // debug frame is not present.
1384 StackFrameId frame_id = break_frame_id();
1385 // If there is no JavaScript stack don't do anything.
1386 if (frame_id == StackFrameId::NO_ID) return;
1387
1388 thread_local_.last_step_action_ = step_action;
1389
1390 DebuggableStackFrameIterator frames_it(isolate_, frame_id);
1391 CommonFrame* frame = frames_it.frame();
1392
1393 BreakLocation location = BreakLocation::Invalid();
1394 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared;
1395 int current_frame_count = CurrentFrameCount();
1396
1397 if (frame->is_java_script()) {
1398 JavaScriptFrame* js_frame = JavaScriptFrame::cast(frame);
1399 DCHECK(IsJSFunction(js_frame->function()));
1400
1401 // Get the debug info (create it if it does not exist).
1402 auto summary = FrameSummary::GetTop(frame).AsJavaScript();
1403 Handle<JSFunction> function(summary.function());
1404 shared = Handle<SharedFunctionInfo>(function->shared(), isolate_);
1405 if (!EnsureBreakInfo(shared)) return;
1406 PrepareFunctionForDebugExecution(shared);
1407
1408 // PrepareFunctionForDebugExecution can invalidate Baseline frames
1409 js_frame = JavaScriptFrame::cast(frames_it.Reframe());
1410
1411 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info(TryGetDebugInfo(*shared).value(), isolate_);
1412 location = BreakLocation::FromFrame(debug_info, js_frame);
1413
1414 // Any step at a return is a step-out, and a step-out at a suspend behaves
1415 // like a return.
1416 if (location.IsReturn() ||
1417 (location.IsSuspend() && step_action == StepOut)) {
1418 // On StepOut we'll ignore our further calls to current function in
1419 // PrepareStepIn callback.
1420 if (last_step_action() == StepOut) {
1421 thread_local_.ignore_step_into_function_ = *function;
1422 }
1423 step_action = StepOut;
1424 thread_local_.last_step_action_ = StepInto;
1425 }
1426
1427 // We need to schedule DebugOnFunction call callback
1428 UpdateHookOnFunctionCall();
1429
1430 // A step-next in blackboxed function is a step-out.
1431 if (step_action == StepOver && IsBlackboxed(shared)) step_action = StepOut;
1432
1433 thread_local_.last_statement_position_ = summary.SourceStatementPosition();
1434 thread_local_.last_bytecode_offset_ = summary.code_offset();
1435 thread_local_.last_frame_count_ = current_frame_count;
1436 // No longer perform the current async step.
1437 clear_suspended_generator();
1438#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1439 } else if (frame->is_wasm() && step_action != StepOut) {
1440 // Handle stepping in wasm.
1441 WasmFrame* wasm_frame = WasmFrame::cast(frame);
1442 auto* debug_info = wasm_frame->native_module()->GetDebugInfo();
1443 if (debug_info->PrepareStep(wasm_frame)) {
1444 UpdateHookOnFunctionCall();
1445 return;
1446 }
1447 // If the wasm code is not debuggable or will return after this step
1448 // (indicated by {PrepareStep} returning false), then step out of that frame
1449 // instead.
1450 step_action = StepOut;
1451 UpdateHookOnFunctionCall();
1452#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1453 }
1454
1455 switch (step_action) {
1456 case StepNone:
1457 UNREACHABLE();
1458 case StepOut: {
1459 // Clear last position info. For stepping out it does not matter.
1460 thread_local_.last_statement_position_ = kNoSourcePosition;
1461 thread_local_.last_bytecode_offset_ = kFunctionEntryBytecodeOffset;
1462 thread_local_.last_frame_count_ = -1;
1463 if (!shared.is_null()) {
1464 if (!location.IsReturnOrSuspend() && !IsBlackboxed(shared)) {
1465 // At not return position we flood return positions with one shots and
1466 // will repeat StepOut automatically at next break.
1467 thread_local_.target_frame_count_ = current_frame_count;
1468 thread_local_.fast_forward_to_return_ = true;
1469 FloodWithOneShot(shared, true);
1470 return;
1471 }
1472 if (IsAsyncFunction(shared->kind())) {
1473 // Stepping out of an async function whose implicit promise is awaited
1474 // by some other async function, should resume the latter. The return
1475 // value here is either a JSPromise or a JSGeneratorObject (for the
1476 // initial yield of async generators).
1477 Handle<JSReceiver> return_value(
1478 JSReceiver::cast(thread_local_.return_value_), isolate_);
1479 Handle<Object> awaited_by_holder = JSReceiver::GetDataProperty(
1480 isolate_, return_value,
1481 isolate_->factory()->promise_awaited_by_symbol());
1482 if (IsWeakFixedArray(*awaited_by_holder, isolate_)) {
1483 Handle<WeakFixedArray> weak_fixed_array =
1484 Handle<WeakFixedArray>::cast(awaited_by_holder);
1485 if (weak_fixed_array->length() == 1 &&
1486 weak_fixed_array->get(0).IsWeak()) {
1487 Handle<HeapObject> awaited_by(
1488 weak_fixed_array->get(0).GetHeapObjectAssumeWeak(isolate_),
1489 isolate_);
1490 if (IsJSGeneratorObject(*awaited_by)) {
1491 DCHECK(!has_suspended_generator());
1492 thread_local_.suspended_generator_ = *awaited_by;
1493 ClearStepping();
1494 return;
1495 }
1496 }
1497 }
1498 }
1499 }
1500 // Skip the current frame, find the first frame we want to step out to
1501 // and deoptimize every frame along the way.
1502 bool in_current_frame = true;
1503 for (; !frames_it.done(); frames_it.Advance()) {
1504#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1505 if (frames_it.frame()->is_wasm()) {
1506 if (in_current_frame) {
1507 in_current_frame = false;
1508 continue;
1509 }
1510 // Handle stepping out into Wasm.
1511 WasmFrame* wasm_frame = WasmFrame::cast(frames_it.frame());
1512 auto* debug_info = wasm_frame->native_module()->GetDebugInfo();
1513 debug_info->PrepareStepOutTo(wasm_frame);
1514 return;
1515 }
1516#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1517 JavaScriptFrame* js_frame = JavaScriptFrame::cast(frames_it.frame());
1518 if (last_step_action() == StepInto) {
1519 // Deoptimize frame to ensure calls are checked for step-in.
1520 Deoptimizer::DeoptimizeFunction(js_frame->function());
1521 }
1522 HandleScope inner_scope(isolate_);
1523 std::vector<Handle<SharedFunctionInfo>> infos;
1524 js_frame->GetFunctions(&infos);
1525 for (; !infos.empty(); current_frame_count--) {
1526 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> info = infos.back();
1527 infos.pop_back();
1528 if (in_current_frame) {
1529 // We want to step out, so skip the current frame.
1530 in_current_frame = false;
1531 continue;
1532 }
1533 if (IsBlackboxed(info)) continue;
1534 FloodWithOneShot(info);
1535 thread_local_.target_frame_count_ = current_frame_count;
1536 return;
1537 }
1538 }
1539 break;
1540 }
1541 case StepOver:
1542 thread_local_.target_frame_count_ = current_frame_count;
1543 [[fallthrough]];
1544 case StepInto:
1545 FloodWithOneShot(shared);
1546 break;
1547 }
1548}
1549
1550// Simple function for returning the source positions for active break points.
1551// static
1552Handle<Object> Debug::GetSourceBreakLocations(
1553 Isolate* isolate, Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared) {
1554 RCS_SCOPE(isolate, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1555 if (!shared->HasBreakInfo(isolate)) {
1556 return isolate->factory()->undefined_value();
1557 }
1558
1559 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info(
1560 isolate->debug()->TryGetDebugInfo(*shared).value(), isolate);
1561 if (debug_info->GetBreakPointCount(isolate) == 0) {
1562 return isolate->factory()->undefined_value();
1563 }
1564 Handle<FixedArray> locations = isolate->factory()->NewFixedArray(
1565 debug_info->GetBreakPointCount(isolate));
1566 int count = 0;
1567 for (int i = 0; i < debug_info->break_points()->length(); ++i) {
1568 if (!IsUndefined(debug_info->break_points()->get(i), isolate)) {
1569 Tagged<BreakPointInfo> break_point_info =
1570 BreakPointInfo::cast(debug_info->break_points()->get(i));
1571 int break_points = break_point_info->GetBreakPointCount(isolate);
1572 if (break_points == 0) continue;
1573 for (int j = 0; j < break_points; ++j) {
1574 locations->set(count++,
1575 Smi::FromInt(break_point_info->source_position()));
1576 }
1577 }
1578 }
1579 return locations;
1580}
1581
1582void Debug::ClearStepping() {
1583 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1584 // Clear the various stepping setup.
1585 ClearOneShot();
1586
1587 thread_local_.last_step_action_ = StepNone;
1588 thread_local_.last_statement_position_ = kNoSourcePosition;
1589 thread_local_.last_bytecode_offset_ = kFunctionEntryBytecodeOffset;
1590 thread_local_.ignore_step_into_function_ = Smi::zero();
1591 thread_local_.fast_forward_to_return_ = false;
1592 thread_local_.last_frame_count_ = -1;
1593 thread_local_.target_frame_count_ = -1;
1594 thread_local_.break_on_next_function_call_ = false;
1595 thread_local_.scheduled_break_on_next_function_call_ = false;
1596 clear_restart_frame();
1597 UpdateHookOnFunctionCall();
1598}
1599
1600// Clears all the one-shot break points that are currently set. Normally this
1601// function is called each time a break point is hit as one shot break points
1602// are used to support stepping.
1603void Debug::ClearOneShot() {
1604 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1605 // The current implementation just runs through all the breakpoints. When the
1606 // last break point for a function is removed that function is automatically
1607 // removed from the list.
1608 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
1609 DebugInfoCollection::Iterator it(&debug_infos_);
1610 for (; it.HasNext(); it.Advance()) {
1611 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info(it.Next(), isolate_);
1612 ClearBreakPoints(debug_info);
1613 ApplyBreakPoints(debug_info);
1614 }
1615}
1616
1617namespace {
1618class DiscardBaselineCodeVisitor : public ThreadVisitor {
1619 public:
1620 explicit DiscardBaselineCodeVisitor(Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> shared)
1621 : shared_(shared) {}
1622 DiscardBaselineCodeVisitor() : shared_(SharedFunctionInfo()) {}
1623
1624 void VisitThread(Isolate* isolate, ThreadLocalTop* top) override {
1625 DisallowGarbageCollection diallow_gc;
1626 bool deopt_all = shared_ == SharedFunctionInfo();
1627 for (JavaScriptStackFrameIterator it(isolate, top); !it.done();
1628 it.Advance()) {
1629 if (!deopt_all && it.frame()->function()->shared() != shared_) continue;
1630 if (it.frame()->type() == StackFrame::BASELINE) {
1631 BaselineFrame* frame = BaselineFrame::cast(it.frame());
1632 int bytecode_offset = frame->GetBytecodeOffset();
1633 Address* pc_addr = frame->pc_address();
1634 Address advance;
1635 if (bytecode_offset == kFunctionEntryBytecodeOffset) {
1636 advance = BUILTIN_CODE(isolate, BaselineOutOfLinePrologueDeopt)
1637 ->instruction_start();
1638 } else {
1639 advance = BUILTIN_CODE(isolate, InterpreterEnterAtNextBytecode)
1640 ->instruction_start();
1641 }
1642 PointerAuthentication::ReplacePC(pc_addr, advance, kSystemPointerSize);
1643 InterpretedFrame::cast(it.Reframe())
1644 ->PatchBytecodeOffset(bytecode_offset);
1645 } else if (it.frame()->type() == StackFrame::INTERPRETED) {
1646 // Check if the PC is a baseline entry trampoline. If it is, replace it
1647 // with the corresponding interpreter entry trampoline.
1648 // This is the case if a baseline function was inlined into a function
1649 // we deoptimized in the debugger and are stepping into it.
1650 JavaScriptFrame* frame = it.frame();
1651 Address pc = frame->pc();
1652 Builtin builtin = OffHeapInstructionStream::TryLookupCode(isolate, pc);
1653 if (builtin == Builtin::kBaselineOrInterpreterEnterAtBytecode ||
1654 builtin == Builtin::kBaselineOrInterpreterEnterAtNextBytecode) {
1655 Address* pc_addr = frame->pc_address();
1656 Builtin advance =
1657 builtin == Builtin::kBaselineOrInterpreterEnterAtBytecode
1658 ? Builtin::kInterpreterEnterAtBytecode
1659 : Builtin::kInterpreterEnterAtNextBytecode;
1660 Address advance_pc =
1661 isolate->builtins()->code(advance)->instruction_start();
1662 PointerAuthentication::ReplacePC(pc_addr, advance_pc,
1663 kSystemPointerSize);
1664 }
1665 }
1666 }
1667 }
1668
1669 private:
1670 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> shared_;
1671};
1672} // namespace
1673
1674void Debug::DiscardBaselineCode(Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> shared) {
1675 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1676 DCHECK(shared->HasBaselineCode());
1677 DiscardBaselineCodeVisitor visitor(shared);
1678 visitor.VisitThread(isolate_, isolate_->thread_local_top());
1679 isolate_->thread_manager()->IterateArchivedThreads(&visitor);
1680 // TODO(v8:11429): Avoid this heap walk somehow.
1681 HeapObjectIterator iterator(isolate_->heap());
1682 auto trampoline = BUILTIN_CODE(isolate_, InterpreterEntryTrampoline);
1683 shared->FlushBaselineCode();
1684 for (Tagged<HeapObject> obj = iterator.Next(); !obj.is_null();
1685 obj = iterator.Next()) {
1686 if (IsJSFunction(obj)) {
1687 Tagged<JSFunction> fun = JSFunction::cast(obj);
1688 if (fun->shared() == shared && fun->ActiveTierIsBaseline(isolate_)) {
1689 fun->set_code(*trampoline);
1690 }
1691 }
1692 }
1693}
1694
1695void Debug::DiscardAllBaselineCode() {
1696 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1697 DiscardBaselineCodeVisitor visitor;
1698 visitor.VisitThread(isolate_, isolate_->thread_local_top());
1699 HeapObjectIterator iterator(isolate_->heap());
1700 auto trampoline = BUILTIN_CODE(isolate_, InterpreterEntryTrampoline);
1701 isolate_->thread_manager()->IterateArchivedThreads(&visitor);
1702 for (Tagged<HeapObject> obj = iterator.Next(); !obj.is_null();
1703 obj = iterator.Next()) {
1704 if (IsJSFunction(obj)) {
1705 Tagged<JSFunction> fun = JSFunction::cast(obj);
1706 if (fun->ActiveTierIsBaseline(isolate_)) {
1707 fun->set_code(*trampoline);
1708 }
1709 } else if (IsSharedFunctionInfo(obj)) {
1710 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> shared = SharedFunctionInfo::cast(obj);
1711 if (shared->HasBaselineCode()) {
1712 shared->FlushBaselineCode();
1713 }
1714 }
1715 }
1716}
1717
1718void Debug::DeoptimizeFunction(Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared) {
1719 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1720
1721 if (shared->HasBaselineCode()) {
1722 DiscardBaselineCode(*shared);
1723 }
1724 Deoptimizer::DeoptimizeAllOptimizedCodeWithFunction(isolate_, shared);
1725}
1726
1727void Debug::PrepareFunctionForDebugExecution(
1728 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared) {
1729 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1730 // To prepare bytecode for debugging, we already need to have the debug
1731 // info (containing the debug copy) upfront, but since we do not recompile,
1732 // preparing for break points cannot fail.
1733 DCHECK(shared->is_compiled());
1734 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info(TryGetDebugInfo(*shared).value(), isolate_);
1735 if (debug_info->flags(kRelaxedLoad) & DebugInfo::kPreparedForDebugExecution) {
1736 return;
1737 }
1738
1739 // Have to discard baseline code before installing debug bytecode, since the
1740 // bytecode array field on the baseline code object is immutable.
1741 if (debug_info->CanBreakAtEntry()) {
1742 // Deopt everything in case the function is inlined anywhere.
1743 Deoptimizer::DeoptimizeAll(isolate_);
1744 DiscardAllBaselineCode();
1745 } else {
1746 DeoptimizeFunction(shared);
1747 }
1748
1749 if (shared->HasBytecodeArray()) {
1750 DCHECK(!shared->HasBaselineCode());
1751 SharedFunctionInfo::InstallDebugBytecode(shared, isolate_);
1752 }
1753
1754 if (debug_info->CanBreakAtEntry()) {
1755 InstallDebugBreakTrampoline();
1756 } else {
1757 // Update PCs on the stack to point to recompiled code.
1758 RedirectActiveFunctions redirect_visitor(
1759 isolate_, *shared, RedirectActiveFunctions::Mode::kUseDebugBytecode);
1760 redirect_visitor.VisitThread(isolate_, isolate_->thread_local_top());
1761 isolate_->thread_manager()->IterateArchivedThreads(&redirect_visitor);
1762 }
1763
1764 debug_info->set_flags(
1765 debug_info->flags(kRelaxedLoad) | DebugInfo::kPreparedForDebugExecution,
1766 kRelaxedStore);
1767}
1768
1769namespace {
1770
1771bool IsJSFunctionAndNeedsTrampoline(Isolate* isolate,
1772 Tagged<Object> maybe_function) {
1773 if (!IsJSFunction(maybe_function)) return false;
1774 base::Optional<Tagged<DebugInfo>> debug_info =
1775 isolate->debug()->TryGetDebugInfo(
1776 JSFunction::cast(maybe_function)->shared());
1777 return debug_info.has_value() && debug_info.value()->CanBreakAtEntry();
1778}
1779
1780} // namespace
1781
1782void Debug::InstallDebugBreakTrampoline() {
1783 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1784 // Check the list of debug infos whether the debug break trampoline needs to
1785 // be installed. If that's the case, iterate the heap for functions to rewire
1786 // to the trampoline.
1787 // If there is a breakpoint at function entry, we need to install trampoline.
1788 bool needs_to_use_trampoline = false;
1789 // If there we break at entry to an api callback, we need to clear ICs.
1790 bool needs_to_clear_ic = false;
1791
1792 DebugInfoCollection::Iterator it(&debug_infos_);
1793 for (; it.HasNext(); it.Advance()) {
1794 Tagged<DebugInfo> debug_info = it.Next();
1795 if (debug_info->CanBreakAtEntry()) {
1796 needs_to_use_trampoline = true;
1797 if (debug_info->shared()->IsApiFunction()) {
1798 needs_to_clear_ic = true;
1799 break;
1800 }
1801 }
1802 }
1803
1804 if (!needs_to_use_trampoline) return;
1805
1806 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
1807 Handle<Code> trampoline = BUILTIN_CODE(isolate_, DebugBreakTrampoline);
1808 std::vector<Handle<JSFunction>> needs_compile;
1809 using AccessorPairWithContext =
1810 std::pair<Handle<AccessorPair>, Handle<NativeContext>>;
1811 std::vector<AccessorPairWithContext> needs_instantiate;
1812 {
1813 // Deduplicate {needs_instantiate} by recording all collected AccessorPairs.
1814 std::set<Tagged<AccessorPair>> recorded;
1815 HeapObjectIterator iterator(isolate_->heap());
1816 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
1817 for (Tagged<HeapObject> obj = iterator.Next(); !obj.is_null();
1818 obj = iterator.Next()) {
1819 if (needs_to_clear_ic && IsFeedbackVector(obj)) {
1820 FeedbackVector::cast(obj)->ClearSlots(isolate_);
1821 continue;
1822 } else if (IsJSFunctionAndNeedsTrampoline(isolate_, obj)) {
1823 Tagged<JSFunction> fun = JSFunction::cast(obj);
1824 if (!fun->is_compiled(isolate_)) {
1825 needs_compile.push_back(handle(fun, isolate_));
1826 } else {
1827 fun->set_code(*trampoline);
1828 }
1829 } else if (IsJSObject(obj)) {
1830 Tagged<JSObject> object = JSObject::cast(obj);
1831 Tagged<DescriptorArray> descriptors =
1832 object->map()->instance_descriptors(kRelaxedLoad);
1833
1834 for (InternalIndex i : object->map()->IterateOwnDescriptors()) {
1835 if (descriptors->GetDetails(i).kind() == PropertyKind::kAccessor) {
1836 Tagged<Object> value = descriptors->GetStrongValue(i);
1837 if (!IsAccessorPair(value)) continue;
1838
1839 Tagged<AccessorPair> accessor_pair = AccessorPair::cast(value);
1840 if (!IsFunctionTemplateInfo(accessor_pair->getter()) &&
1841 !IsFunctionTemplateInfo(accessor_pair->setter())) {
1842 continue;
1843 }
1844 if (recorded.find(accessor_pair) != recorded.end()) continue;
1845
1846 needs_instantiate.emplace_back(
1847 handle(accessor_pair, isolate_),
1848 handle(object->GetCreationContext().value(), isolate_));
1849 recorded.insert(accessor_pair);
1850 }
1851 }
1852 }
1853 }
1854 }
1855
1856 // Forcibly instantiate all lazy accessor pairs to make sure that they
1857 // properly hit the debug break trampoline.
1858 for (AccessorPairWithContext tuple : needs_instantiate) {
1859 Handle<AccessorPair> accessor_pair = tuple.first;
1860 Handle<NativeContext> native_context = tuple.second;
1861 Handle<Object> getter = AccessorPair::GetComponent(
1862 isolate_, native_context, accessor_pair, ACCESSOR_GETTER);
1863 if (IsJSFunctionAndNeedsTrampoline(isolate_, *getter)) {
1864 Handle<JSFunction>::cast(getter)->set_code(*trampoline);
1865 }
1866
1867 Handle<Object> setter = AccessorPair::GetComponent(
1868 isolate_, native_context, accessor_pair, ACCESSOR_SETTER);
1869 if (IsJSFunctionAndNeedsTrampoline(isolate_, *setter)) {
1870 Handle<JSFunction>::cast(setter)->set_code(*trampoline);
1871 }
1872 }
1873
1874 // By overwriting the function code with DebugBreakTrampoline, which tailcalls
1875 // to shared code, we bypass CompileLazy. Perform CompileLazy here instead.
1876 for (Handle<JSFunction> fun : needs_compile) {
1877 IsCompiledScope is_compiled_scope;
1878 Compiler::Compile(isolate_, fun, Compiler::CLEAR_EXCEPTION,
1879 &is_compiled_scope);
1880 DCHECK(is_compiled_scope.is_compiled());
1881 fun->set_code(*trampoline);
1882 }
1883}
1884
1885namespace {
1886void FindBreakablePositions(Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info, int start_position,
1887 int end_position,
1888 std::vector<BreakLocation>* locations) {
1889 DCHECK(debug_info->HasInstrumentedBytecodeArray());
1890 BreakIterator it(debug_info);
1891 while (!it.Done()) {
1892 if (it.GetDebugBreakType() != DEBUG_BREAK_SLOT_AT_SUSPEND &&
1893 it.position() >= start_position && it.position() < end_position) {
1894 locations->push_back(it.GetBreakLocation());
1895 }
1896 it.Next();
1897 }
1898}
1899
1900bool CompileTopLevel(Isolate* isolate, Handle<Script> script,
1901 MaybeHandle<SharedFunctionInfo>* result = nullptr) {
1902 UnoptimizedCompileState compile_state;
1903 ReusableUnoptimizedCompileState reusable_state(isolate);
1904 UnoptimizedCompileFlags flags =
1905 UnoptimizedCompileFlags::ForScriptCompile(isolate, *script);
1906 flags.set_is_reparse(true);
1907 ParseInfo parse_info(isolate, flags, &compile_state, &reusable_state);
1908 IsCompiledScope is_compiled_scope;
1909 const MaybeHandle<SharedFunctionInfo> maybe_result =
1910 Compiler::CompileToplevel(&parse_info, script, isolate,
1911 &is_compiled_scope);
1912 if (maybe_result.is_null()) {
1913 if (isolate->has_exception()) {
1914 isolate->clear_exception();
1915 }
1916 return false;
1917 }
1918 if (result) *result = maybe_result;
1919 return true;
1920}
1921} // namespace
1922
1923bool Debug::GetPossibleBreakpoints(Handle<Script> script, int start_position,
1924 int end_position, bool restrict_to_function,
1925 std::vector<BreakLocation>* locations) {
1926 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
1927 if (restrict_to_function) {
1928 Handle<Object> result =
1929 FindInnermostContainingFunctionInfo(script, start_position);
1930 if (IsUndefined(*result, isolate_)) return false;
1931
1932 // Make sure the function has set up the debug info.
1933 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared =
1934 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo>::cast(result);
1935 if (!EnsureBreakInfo(shared)) return false;
1936 PrepareFunctionForDebugExecution(shared);
1937
1938 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info(TryGetDebugInfo(*shared).value(), isolate_);
1939 FindBreakablePositions(debug_info, start_position, end_position, locations);
1940 return true;
1941 }
1942
1943 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
1944 std::vector<Handle<SharedFunctionInfo>> candidates;
1945 if (!FindSharedFunctionInfosIntersectingRange(script, start_position,
1946 end_position, &candidates)) {
1947 return false;
1948 }
1949 for (const auto& candidate : candidates) {
1950 CHECK(candidate->HasBreakInfo(isolate_));
1951 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info(TryGetDebugInfo(*candidate).value(), isolate_);
1952 FindBreakablePositions(debug_info, start_position, end_position, locations);
1953 }
1954 return true;
1955}
1956
1957class SharedFunctionInfoFinder {
1958 public:
1959 explicit SharedFunctionInfoFinder(int target_position)
1960 : current_start_position_(kNoSourcePosition),
1961 target_position_(target_position) {}
1962
1963 void NewCandidate(Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> shared,
1964 Tagged<JSFunction> closure = JSFunction()) {
1965 if (!shared->IsSubjectToDebugging()) return;
1966 int start_position = shared->function_token_position();
1967 if (start_position == kNoSourcePosition) {
1968 start_position = shared->StartPosition();
1969 }
1970
1971 if (start_position > target_position_) return;
1972 if (target_position_ >= shared->EndPosition()) {
1973 // The SharedFunctionInfo::EndPosition() is generally exclusive, but there
1974 // are assumptions in various places in the debugger that for script level
1975 // (toplevel function) there's an end position that is technically outside
1976 // the script. It might be worth revisiting the overall design here at
1977 // some point in the future.
1978 if (!shared->is_toplevel() || target_position_ > shared->EndPosition()) {
1979 return;
1980 }
1981 }
1982
1983 if (!current_candidate_.is_null()) {
1984 if (current_start_position_ == start_position &&
1985 shared->EndPosition() == current_candidate_->EndPosition()) {
1986 // If we already have a matching closure, do not throw it away.
1987 if (!current_candidate_closure_.is_null() && closure.is_null()) return;
1988 // If a top-level function contains only one function
1989 // declaration the source for the top-level and the function
1990 // is the same. In that case prefer the non top-level function.
1991 if (!current_candidate_->is_toplevel() && shared->is_toplevel()) return;
1992 } else if (start_position < current_start_position_ ||
1993 current_candidate_->EndPosition() < shared->EndPosition()) {
1994 return;
1995 }
1996 }
1997
1998 current_start_position_ = start_position;
1999 current_candidate_ = shared;
2000 current_candidate_closure_ = closure;
2001 }
2002
2003 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> Result() { return current_candidate_; }
2004
2005 Tagged<JSFunction> ResultClosure() { return current_candidate_closure_; }
2006
2007 private:
2008 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> current_candidate_;
2009 Tagged<JSFunction> current_candidate_closure_;
2010 int current_start_position_;
2011 int target_position_;
2012 DISALLOW_GARBAGE_COLLECTION(no_gc_)
2013};
2014
2015namespace {
2016Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> FindSharedFunctionInfoCandidate(
2017 int position, Handle<Script> script, Isolate* isolate) {
2018 SharedFunctionInfoFinder finder(position);
2019 SharedFunctionInfo::ScriptIterator iterator(isolate, *script);
2020 for (Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> info = iterator.Next(); !info.is_null();
2021 info = iterator.Next()) {
2022 finder.NewCandidate(info);
2023 }
2024 return finder.Result();
2025}
2026} // namespace
2027
2028Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> Debug::FindClosestSharedFunctionInfoFromPosition(
2029 int position, Handle<Script> script,
2030 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> outer_shared) {
2031 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2032 Handle<DebugInfo> outer_debug_info(TryGetDebugInfo(*outer_shared).value(),
2033 isolate_);
2034 CHECK(outer_debug_info->HasBreakInfo());
2035 int closest_position = FindBreakablePosition(outer_debug_info, position);
2036 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> closest_candidate = outer_shared;
2037 if (closest_position == position) return outer_shared;
2038
2039 const int start_position = outer_shared->StartPosition();
2040 const int end_position = outer_shared->EndPosition();
2041 if (start_position == end_position) return outer_shared;
2042
2043 if (closest_position == 0) closest_position = end_position;
2044 std::vector<Handle<SharedFunctionInfo>> candidates;
2045 // Find all shared function infos of functions that are intersecting from
2046 // the requested position until the end of the enclosing function.
2047 if (!FindSharedFunctionInfosIntersectingRange(
2048 script, position, closest_position, &candidates)) {
2049 return outer_shared;
2050 }
2051
2052 for (auto candidate : candidates) {
2053 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info(TryGetDebugInfo(*candidate).value(), isolate_);
2054 CHECK(debug_info->HasBreakInfo());
2055 const int candidate_position = FindBreakablePosition(debug_info, position);
2056 if (candidate_position >= position &&
2057 candidate_position < closest_position) {
2058 closest_position = candidate_position;
2059 closest_candidate = candidate;
2060 }
2061 if (closest_position == position) break;
2062 }
2063 return closest_candidate;
2064}
2065
2066bool Debug::FindSharedFunctionInfosIntersectingRange(
2067 Handle<Script> script, int start_position, int end_position,
2068 std::vector<Handle<SharedFunctionInfo>>* intersecting_shared) {
2069 bool candidateSubsumesRange = false;
2070 bool triedTopLevelCompile = false;
2071
2072 while (true) {
2073 std::vector<Handle<SharedFunctionInfo>> candidates;
2074 std::vector<IsCompiledScope> compiled_scopes;
2075 {
2076 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
2077 SharedFunctionInfo::ScriptIterator iterator(isolate_, *script);
2078 for (Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> info = iterator.Next(); !info.is_null();
2079 info = iterator.Next()) {
2080 if (info->EndPosition() < start_position ||
2081 info->StartPosition() >= end_position) {
2082 continue;
2083 }
2084 candidateSubsumesRange |= info->StartPosition() <= start_position &&
2085 info->EndPosition() >= end_position;
2086 if (!info->IsSubjectToDebugging()) continue;
2087 if (!info->is_compiled() && !info->allows_lazy_compilation()) continue;
2088 candidates.push_back(i::handle(info, isolate_));
2089 }
2090 }
2091
2092 if (!triedTopLevelCompile && !candidateSubsumesRange &&
2093 script->shared_function_info_count() > 0) {
2094 MaybeHandle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared =
2095 GetTopLevelWithRecompile(script, &triedTopLevelCompile);
2096 if (shared.is_null()) return false;
2097 if (triedTopLevelCompile) continue;
2098 }
2099
2100 bool was_compiled = false;
2101 for (const auto& candidate : candidates) {
2102 IsCompiledScope is_compiled_scope(candidate->is_compiled_scope(isolate_));
2103 if (!is_compiled_scope.is_compiled()) {
2104 // InstructionStream that cannot be compiled lazily are internal and not
