2105 // debuggable.
2106 DCHECK(candidate->allows_lazy_compilation());
2107 if (!Compiler::Compile(isolate_, candidate, Compiler::CLEAR_EXCEPTION,
2108 &is_compiled_scope)) {
2109 return false;
2110 } else {
2111 was_compiled = true;
2112 }
2113 }
2114 DCHECK(is_compiled_scope.is_compiled());
2115 compiled_scopes.push_back(is_compiled_scope);
2116 if (!EnsureBreakInfo(candidate)) return false;
2117 PrepareFunctionForDebugExecution(candidate);
2118 }
2119 if (was_compiled) continue;
2120 *intersecting_shared = std::move(candidates);
2121 return true;
2122 }
2123 UNREACHABLE();
2124}
2125
2126MaybeHandle<SharedFunctionInfo> Debug::GetTopLevelWithRecompile(
2127 Handle<Script> script, bool* did_compile) {
2128 DCHECK_LE(kFunctionLiteralIdTopLevel, script->shared_function_info_count());
2129 DCHECK_LE(script->shared_function_info_count(),
2130 script->shared_function_infos()->length());
2131 Tagged<MaybeObject> maybeToplevel = script->shared_function_infos()->get(0);
2132 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object;
2133 const bool topLevelInfoExists =
2134 maybeToplevel.GetHeapObject(&heap_object) && !IsUndefined(heap_object);
2135 if (topLevelInfoExists) {
2136 if (did_compile) *did_compile = false;
2137 return handle(SharedFunctionInfo::cast(heap_object), isolate_);
2138 }
2139
2140 MaybeHandle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared;
2141 CompileTopLevel(isolate_, script, &shared);
2142 if (did_compile) *did_compile = true;
2143 return shared;
2144}
2145
2146// We need to find a SFI for a literal that may not yet have been compiled yet,
2147// and there may not be a JSFunction referencing it. Find the SFI closest to
2148// the given position, compile it to reveal possible inner SFIs and repeat.
2149// While we are at this, also ensure code with debug break slots so that we do
2150// not have to compile a SFI without JSFunction, which is paifu for those that
2151// cannot be compiled without context (need to find outer compilable SFI etc.)
2152Handle<Object> Debug::FindInnermostContainingFunctionInfo(Handle<Script> script,
2153 int position) {
2154 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2155 for (int iteration = 0;; iteration++) {
2156 // Go through all shared function infos associated with this script to
2157 // find the innermost function containing this position.
2158 // If there is no shared function info for this script at all, there is
2159 // no point in looking for it by walking the heap.
2160
2161 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> shared;
2162 IsCompiledScope is_compiled_scope;
2163 {
2164 shared = FindSharedFunctionInfoCandidate(position, script, isolate_);
2165 if (shared.is_null()) {
2166 if (iteration > 0) break;
2167 // It might be that the shared function info is not available as the
2168 // top level functions are removed due to the GC. Try to recompile
2169 // the top level functions.
2170 const bool success = CompileTopLevel(isolate_, script);
2171 if (!success) break;
2172 continue;
2173 }
2174 // We found it if it's already compiled.
2175 is_compiled_scope = shared->is_compiled_scope(isolate_);
2176 if (is_compiled_scope.is_compiled()) {
2177 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared_handle(shared, isolate_);
2178 // If the iteration count is larger than 1, we had to compile the outer
2179 // function in order to create this shared function info. So there can
2180 // be no JSFunction referencing it. We can anticipate creating a debug
2181 // info while bypassing PrepareFunctionForDebugExecution.
2182 if (iteration > 1) {
2183 CreateBreakInfo(shared_handle);
2184 }
2185 return shared_handle;
2186 }
2187 }
2188 // If not, compile to reveal inner functions.
2189 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
2190 // InstructionStream that cannot be compiled lazily are internal and not
2191 // debuggable.
2192 DCHECK(shared->allows_lazy_compilation());
2193 if (!Compiler::Compile(isolate_, handle(shared, isolate_),
2194 Compiler::CLEAR_EXCEPTION, &is_compiled_scope)) {
2195 break;
2196 }
2197 }
2198 return isolate_->factory()->undefined_value();
2199}
2200
2201// Ensures the debug information is present for shared.
2202bool Debug::EnsureBreakInfo(Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared) {
2203 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2204 // Return if we already have the break info for shared.
2205 if (shared->HasBreakInfo(isolate_)) {
2206 DCHECK(shared->is_compiled());
2207 return true;
2208 }
2209 if (!shared->IsSubjectToDebugging() && !CanBreakAtEntry(shared)) {
2210 return false;
2211 }
2212 IsCompiledScope is_compiled_scope = shared->is_compiled_scope(isolate_);
2213 if (!is_compiled_scope.is_compiled() &&
2214 !Compiler::Compile(isolate_, shared, Compiler::CLEAR_EXCEPTION,
2215 &is_compiled_scope, CreateSourcePositions::kYes)) {
2216 return false;
2217 }
2218 CreateBreakInfo(shared);
2219 return true;
2220}
2221
2222void Debug::CreateBreakInfo(Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared) {
2223 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2224 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
2225 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info = GetOrCreateDebugInfo(shared);
2226
2227 // Initialize with break information.
2228
2229 DCHECK(!debug_info->HasBreakInfo());
2230
2231 Factory* factory = isolate_->factory();
2232 Handle<FixedArray> break_points(
2233 factory->NewFixedArray(DebugInfo::kEstimatedNofBreakPointsInFunction));
2234
2235 int flags = debug_info->flags(kRelaxedLoad);
2236 flags |= DebugInfo::kHasBreakInfo;
2237 if (CanBreakAtEntry(shared)) flags |= DebugInfo::kCanBreakAtEntry;
2238 debug_info->set_flags(flags, kRelaxedStore);
2239 debug_info->set_break_points(*break_points);
2240
2241 SharedFunctionInfo::EnsureSourcePositionsAvailable(isolate_, shared);
2242}
2243
2244Handle<DebugInfo> Debug::GetOrCreateDebugInfo(
2245 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared) {
2246 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2247
2248 if (base::Optional<Tagged<DebugInfo>> di = debug_infos_.Find(*shared)) {
2249 return handle(di.value(), isolate_);
2250 }
2251
2252 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info = isolate_->factory()->NewDebugInfo(shared);
2253 debug_infos_.Insert(*shared, *debug_info);
2254 return debug_info;
2255}
2256
2257void Debug::InstallCoverageInfo(Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared,
2258 Handle<CoverageInfo> coverage_info) {
2259 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2260 DCHECK(!coverage_info.is_null());
2261
2262 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info = GetOrCreateDebugInfo(shared);
2263
2264 DCHECK(!debug_info->HasCoverageInfo());
2265
2266 debug_info->set_flags(
2267 debug_info->flags(kRelaxedLoad) | DebugInfo::kHasCoverageInfo,
2268 kRelaxedStore);
2269 debug_info->set_coverage_info(*coverage_info);
2270}
2271
2272void Debug::RemoveAllCoverageInfos() {
2273 ClearAllDebugInfos(
2274 [=](Handle<DebugInfo> info) { info->ClearCoverageInfo(isolate_); });
2275}
2276
2277void Debug::ClearAllDebuggerHints() {
2278 ClearAllDebugInfos(
2279 [=](Handle<DebugInfo> info) { info->set_debugger_hints(0); });
2280}
2281
2282void Debug::ClearAllDebugInfos(const DebugInfoClearFunction& clear_function) {
2283 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2284
2285 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
2286 DebugInfoCollection::Iterator it(&debug_infos_);
2287 for (; it.HasNext(); it.Advance()) {
2288 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info(it.Next(), isolate_);
2289 clear_function(debug_info);
2290 if (debug_info->IsEmpty()) it.DeleteNext();
2291 }
2292}
2293
2294void Debug::RemoveBreakInfoAndMaybeFree(Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info) {
2295 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2296 debug_info->ClearBreakInfo(isolate_);
2297 if (debug_info->IsEmpty()) {
2298 debug_infos_.DeleteSlow(debug_info->shared());
2299 }
2300}
2301
2302bool Debug::IsBreakAtReturn(JavaScriptFrame* frame) {
2303 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2304 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
2305
2306 // Get the executing function in which the debug break occurred.
2307 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared(frame->function()->shared(), isolate_);
2308
2309 // With no debug info there are no break points, so we can't be at a return.
2310 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info;
2311 if (!ToHandle(isolate_, TryGetDebugInfo(*shared), &debug_info) ||
2312 !debug_info->HasBreakInfo()) {
2313 return false;
2314 }
2315
2316 DCHECK(!frame->is_optimized());
2317 BreakLocation location = BreakLocation::FromFrame(debug_info, frame);
2318 return location.IsReturn();
2319}
2320
2321Handle<FixedArray> Debug::GetLoadedScripts() {
2322 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2323 isolate_->heap()->CollectAllGarbage(GCFlag::kNoFlags,
2324 GarbageCollectionReason::kDebugger);
2325 Factory* factory = isolate_->factory();
2326 if (!IsWeakArrayList(*factory->script_list())) {
2327 return factory->empty_fixed_array();
2328 }
2329 Handle<WeakArrayList> array =
2330 Handle<WeakArrayList>::cast(factory->script_list());
2331 Handle<FixedArray> results = factory->NewFixedArray(array->length());
2332 int length = 0;
2333 {
2334 Script::Iterator iterator(isolate_);
2335 for (Tagged<Script> script = iterator.Next(); !script.is_null();
2336 script = iterator.Next()) {
2337 if (script->HasValidSource()) results->set(length++, script);
2338 }
2339 }
2340 return FixedArray::RightTrimOrEmpty(isolate_, results, length);
2341}
2342
2343base::Optional<Tagged<DebugInfo>> Debug::TryGetDebugInfo(
2344 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> sfi) {
2345 return debug_infos_.Find(sfi);
2346}
2347
2348bool Debug::HasDebugInfo(Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> sfi) {
2349 return TryGetDebugInfo(sfi).has_value();
2350}
2351
2352bool Debug::HasCoverageInfo(Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> sfi) {
2353 if (base::Optional<Tagged<DebugInfo>> debug_info = TryGetDebugInfo(sfi)) {
2354 return debug_info.value()->HasCoverageInfo();
2355 }
2356 return false;
2357}
2358
2359bool Debug::HasBreakInfo(Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> sfi) {
2360 if (base::Optional<Tagged<DebugInfo>> debug_info = TryGetDebugInfo(sfi)) {
2361 return debug_info.value()->HasBreakInfo();
2362 }
2363 return false;
2364}
2365
2366bool Debug::BreakAtEntry(Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> sfi) {
2367 if (base::Optional<Tagged<DebugInfo>> debug_info = TryGetDebugInfo(sfi)) {
2368 return debug_info.value()->BreakAtEntry();
2369 }
2370 return false;
2371}
2372
2373base::Optional<Tagged<Object>> Debug::OnThrow(Handle<Object> exception) {
2374 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2375 if (in_debug_scope() || ignore_events()) return {};
2376 // Temporarily clear any exception to allow evaluating
2377 // JavaScript from the debug event handler.
2378 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
2379 {
2380 base::Optional<Isolate::ExceptionScope> exception_scope;
2381 if (isolate_->has_exception()) exception_scope.emplace(isolate_);
2382 Isolate::CatchType catch_type = isolate_->PredictExceptionCatcher();
2383 OnException(exception, MaybeHandle<JSPromise>(),
2384 catch_type == Isolate::CAUGHT_BY_ASYNC_AWAIT ||
2385 catch_type == Isolate::CAUGHT_BY_PROMISE
2386 ? v8::debug::kPromiseRejection
2387 : v8::debug::kException);
2388 }
2389 PrepareStepOnThrow();
2390 // If the OnException handler requested termination, then indicated this to
2391 // our caller Isolate::Throw so it can deal with it immediatelly instead of
2392 // throwing the original exception.
2393 if (isolate_->stack_guard()->CheckTerminateExecution()) {
2394 isolate_->stack_guard()->ClearTerminateExecution();
2395 return isolate_->TerminateExecution();
2396 }
2397 return {};
2398}
2399
2400void Debug::OnPromiseReject(Handle<Object> promise, Handle<Object> value) {
2401 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2402 if (in_debug_scope() || ignore_events()) return;
2403 MaybeHandle<JSPromise> maybe_promise;
2404 if (IsJSPromise(*promise)) {
2405 Handle<JSPromise> js_promise = Handle<JSPromise>::cast(promise);
2406 if (js_promise->is_silent()) {
2407 return;
2408 }
2409 maybe_promise = js_promise;
2410 }
2411 OnException(value, maybe_promise, v8::debug::kPromiseRejection);
2412}
2413
2414bool Debug::IsFrameBlackboxed(JavaScriptFrame* frame) {
2415 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2416 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
2417 std::vector<Handle<SharedFunctionInfo>> infos;
2418 frame->GetFunctions(&infos);
2419 for (const auto& info : infos) {
2420 if (!IsBlackboxed(info)) return false;
2421 }
2422 return true;
2423}
2424
2425void Debug::OnException(Handle<Object> exception,
2426 MaybeHandle<JSPromise> promise,
2427 v8::debug::ExceptionType exception_type) {
2428 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2429 // Do not trigger exception event on stack overflow. We cannot perform
2430 // anything useful for debugging in that situation.
2431 StackLimitCheck stack_limit_check(isolate_);
2432 if (stack_limit_check.JsHasOverflowed()) return;
2433
2434 // Return if the event has nowhere to go.
2435 if (!debug_delegate_) return;
2436
2437 // Return if we are not interested in exception events.
2438 if (!break_on_caught_exception_ && !break_on_uncaught_exception_) return;
2439
2440 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
2441
2442 bool all_frames_ignored = true;
2443 bool is_debuggable = false;
2444 bool uncaught = !isolate_->WalkCallStackAndPromiseTree(
2445 promise, [this, &all_frames_ignored,
2446 &is_debuggable](Isolate::PromiseHandler handler) {
2447 if (!handler.async) {
2448 is_debuggable = true;
2449 } else if (!is_debuggable) {
2450 // Don't bother checking ignore listing if there are no debuggable
2451 // frames on the callstack
2452 return;
2453 }
2454 all_frames_ignored =
2455 all_frames_ignored &&
2456 IsBlackboxed(handle(handler.function_info, isolate_));
2457 });
2458
2459 if (all_frames_ignored || !is_debuggable) {
2460 return;
2461 }
2462
2463 if (!uncaught) {
2464 if (!break_on_caught_exception_) {
2465 return;
2466 }
2467 } else {
2468 if (!break_on_uncaught_exception_) {
2469 return;
2470 }
2471 }
2472
2473 {
2474 JavaScriptStackFrameIterator it(isolate_);
2475 // Check whether the affected frames are blackboxed or the break location is
2476 // muted.
2477 if (!it.done() && (IsMutedAtCurrentLocation(it.frame()))) {
2478 return;
2479 }
2480 if (it.done()) return; // Do not trigger an event with an empty stack.
2481 }
2482
2483 DebugScope debug_scope(this);
2484 DisableBreak no_recursive_break(this);
2485
2486 {
2487 Handle<Object> promise_object;
2488 if (!promise.ToHandle(&promise_object)) {
2489 promise_object = isolate_->factory()->undefined_value();
2490 }
2491 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebuggerCallback);
2492 debug_delegate_->ExceptionThrown(
2493 v8::Utils::ToLocal(isolate_->native_context()),
2494 v8::Utils::ToLocal(exception), v8::Utils::ToLocal(promise_object),
2495 uncaught, exception_type);
2496 }
2497}
2498
2499void Debug::OnDebugBreak(Handle<FixedArray> break_points_hit,
2500 StepAction lastStepAction,
2501 v8::debug::BreakReasons break_reasons) {
2502 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2503 DCHECK(!break_points_hit.is_null());
2504 // The caller provided for DebugScope.
2505 AssertDebugContext();
2506 // Bail out if there is no listener for this event
2507 if (ignore_events()) return;
2508
2509#ifdef DEBUG
2510 PrintBreakLocation();
2511#endif // DEBUG
2512
2513 if (!debug_delegate_) return;
2514 DCHECK(in_debug_scope());
2515 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
2516 DisableBreak no_recursive_break(this);
2517
2518 if ((lastStepAction == StepAction::StepOver ||
2519 lastStepAction == StepAction::StepInto) &&
2520 ShouldBeSkipped()) {
2521 PrepareStep(lastStepAction);
2522 return;
2523 }
2524
2525 std::vector<int> inspector_break_points_hit;
2526 // This array contains breakpoints installed using JS debug API.
2527 for (int i = 0; i < break_points_hit->length(); ++i) {
2528 Tagged<BreakPoint> break_point = BreakPoint::cast(break_points_hit->get(i));
2529 inspector_break_points_hit.push_back(break_point->id());
2530 }
2531 {
2532 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebuggerCallback);
2533 if (lastStepAction != StepAction::StepNone)
2534 break_reasons.Add(debug::BreakReason::kStep);
2535 debug_delegate_->BreakProgramRequested(
2536 v8::Utils::ToLocal(isolate_->native_context()),
2537 inspector_break_points_hit, break_reasons);
2538 }
2539}
2540
2541namespace {
2542debug::Location GetDebugLocation(Handle<Script> script, int source_position) {
2543 Script::PositionInfo info;
2544 Script::GetPositionInfo(script, source_position, &info);
2545 // V8 provides ScriptCompiler::CompileFunction method which takes
2546 // expression and compile it as anonymous function like (function() ..
2547 // expression ..). To produce correct locations for stmts inside of this
2548 // expression V8 compile this function with negative offset. Instead of stmt
2549 // position blackboxing use function start position which is negative in
2550 // described case.
2551 return debug::Location(std::max(info.line, 0), std::max(info.column, 0));
2552}
2553} // namespace
2554
2555bool Debug::IsBlackboxed(Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared) {
2556 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2557 if (!debug_delegate_) return !shared->IsSubjectToDebugging();
2558 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info = GetOrCreateDebugInfo(shared);
2559 if (!debug_info->computed_debug_is_blackboxed()) {
2560 bool is_blackboxed =
2561 !shared->IsSubjectToDebugging() || !IsScript(shared->script());
2562 if (!is_blackboxed) {
2563 SuppressDebug while_processing(this);
2564 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate_);
2565 PostponeInterruptsScope no_interrupts(isolate_);
2566 DisableBreak no_recursive_break(this);
2567 DCHECK(IsScript(shared->script()));
2568 Handle<Script> script(Script::cast(shared->script()), isolate_);
2569 DCHECK(script->IsUserJavaScript());
2570 debug::Location start = GetDebugLocation(script, shared->StartPosition());
2571 debug::Location end = GetDebugLocation(script, shared->EndPosition());
2572 {
2573 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebuggerCallback);
2574 is_blackboxed = debug_delegate_->IsFunctionBlackboxed(
2575 ToApiHandle<debug::Script>(script), start, end);
2576 }
2577 }
2578 debug_info->set_debug_is_blackboxed(is_blackboxed);
2579 debug_info->set_computed_debug_is_blackboxed(true);
2580 }
2581 return debug_info->debug_is_blackboxed();
2582}
2583
2584bool Debug::ShouldBeSkipped() {
2585 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2586 SuppressDebug while_processing(this);
2587 PostponeInterruptsScope no_interrupts(isolate_);
2588 DisableBreak no_recursive_break(this);
2589
2590 DebuggableStackFrameIterator iterator(isolate_);
2591 FrameSummary summary = iterator.GetTopValidFrame();
2592 Handle<Object> script_obj = summary.script();
2593 if (!IsScript(*script_obj)) return false;
2594
2595 Handle<Script> script = Handle<Script>::cast(script_obj);
2596 summary.EnsureSourcePositionsAvailable();
2597 int source_position = summary.SourcePosition();
2598 Script::PositionInfo info;
2599 Script::GetPositionInfo(script, source_position, &info);
2600 {
2601 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebuggerCallback);
2602 return debug_delegate_->ShouldBeSkipped(ToApiHandle<debug::Script>(script),
2603 info.line, info.column);
2604 }
2605}
2606
2607bool Debug::AllFramesOnStackAreBlackboxed() {
2608 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2609
2610 for (StackFrameIterator it(isolate_); !it.done(); it.Advance()) {
2611 StackFrame* frame = it.frame();
2612 if (frame->is_java_script() &&
2613 !IsFrameBlackboxed(JavaScriptFrame::cast(frame))) {
2614 return false;
2615 }
2616 }
2617 return true;
2618}
2619
2620bool Debug::CanBreakAtEntry(Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared) {
2621 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2622 // Allow break at entry for builtin functions.
2623 if (shared->native() || shared->IsApiFunction()) {
2624 // Functions that are subject to debugging can have regular breakpoints.
2625 DCHECK(!shared->IsSubjectToDebugging());
2626 return true;
2627 }
2628 return false;
2629}
2630
2631bool Debug::SetScriptSource(Handle<Script> script, Handle<String> source,
2632 bool preview, bool allow_top_frame_live_editing,
2633 debug::LiveEditResult* result) {
2634 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2635 DebugScope debug_scope(this);
2636 running_live_edit_ = true;
2637 LiveEdit::PatchScript(isolate_, script, source, preview,
2638 allow_top_frame_live_editing, result);
2639 running_live_edit_ = false;
2640 return result->status == debug::LiveEditResult::OK;
2641}
2642
2643void Debug::OnCompileError(Handle<Script> script) {
2644 ProcessCompileEvent(true, script);
2645}
2646
2647void Debug::OnAfterCompile(Handle<Script> script) {
2648 ProcessCompileEvent(false, script);
2649}
2650
2651void Debug::ProcessCompileEvent(bool has_compile_error, Handle<Script> script) {
2652 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2653 // Ignore temporary scripts.
2654 if (script->id() == Script::kTemporaryScriptId) return;
2655 // TODO(kozyatinskiy): teach devtools to work with liveedit scripts better
2656 // first and then remove this fast return.
2657 if (running_live_edit_) return;
2658 // Attach the correct debug id to the script. The debug id is used by the
2659 // inspector to filter scripts by native context.
2660 script->set_context_data(isolate_->native_context()->debug_context_id());
2661 if (ignore_events()) return;
2662 if (!script->IsSubjectToDebugging()) return;
2663 if (!debug_delegate_) return;
2664 SuppressDebug while_processing(this);
2665 DebugScope debug_scope(this);
2666 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
2667 DisableBreak no_recursive_break(this);
2668 AllowJavascriptExecution allow_script(isolate_);
2669 {
2670 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebuggerCallback);
2671 debug_delegate_->ScriptCompiled(ToApiHandle<debug::Script>(script),
2672 running_live_edit_, has_compile_error);
2673 }
2674}
2675
2676int Debug::CurrentFrameCount() {
2677 DebuggableStackFrameIterator it(isolate_);
2678 if (break_frame_id() != StackFrameId::NO_ID) {
2679 // Skip to break frame.
2680 DCHECK(in_debug_scope());
2681 while (!it.done() && it.frame()->id() != break_frame_id()) it.Advance();
2682 }
2683 int counter = 0;
2684 for (; !it.done(); it.Advance()) {
2685 counter += it.FrameFunctionCount();
2686 }
2687 return counter;
2688}
2689
2690void Debug::SetDebugDelegate(debug::DebugDelegate* delegate) {
2691 debug_delegate_ = delegate;
2692 UpdateState();
2693}
2694
2695void Debug::UpdateState() {
2696 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2697 bool is_active = debug_delegate_ != nullptr;
2698 if (is_active == is_active_) return;
2699 if (is_active) {
2700 // Note that the debug context could have already been loaded to
2701 // bootstrap test cases.
2702 isolate_->compilation_cache()->DisableScriptAndEval();
2703 isolate_->CollectSourcePositionsForAllBytecodeArrays();
2704 is_active = true;
2705 } else {
2706 isolate_->compilation_cache()->EnableScriptAndEval();
2707 Unload();
2708 }
2709 is_active_ = is_active;
2710 isolate_->PromiseHookStateUpdated();
2711}
2712
2713void Debug::UpdateHookOnFunctionCall() {
2714 static_assert(LastStepAction == StepInto);
2715 hook_on_function_call_ =
2716 thread_local_.last_step_action_ == StepInto ||
2717 isolate_->debug_execution_mode() == DebugInfo::kSideEffects ||
2718 thread_local_.break_on_next_function_call_;
2719}
2720
2721void Debug::HandleDebugBreak(IgnoreBreakMode ignore_break_mode,
2722 v8::debug::BreakReasons break_reasons) {
2723 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2724 // Ignore debug break during bootstrapping.
2725 if (isolate_->bootstrapper()->IsActive()) return;
2726 // Just continue if breaks are disabled.
2727 if (break_disabled()) return;
2728 // Ignore debug break if debugger is not active.
2729 if (!is_active()) return;
2730
2731 StackLimitCheck check(isolate_);
2732 if (check.HasOverflowed()) return;
2733
2734 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
2735 MaybeHandle<FixedArray> break_points;
2736 {
2737 DebuggableStackFrameIterator it(isolate_);
2738 DCHECK(!it.done());
2739 JavaScriptFrame* frame = it.frame()->is_java_script()
2740 ? JavaScriptFrame::cast(it.frame())
2741 : nullptr;
2742 if (frame && IsJSFunction(frame->function())) {
2743 Handle<JSFunction> function(frame->function(), isolate_);
2744 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared(function->shared(), isolate_);
2745
2746 // kScheduled breaks are triggered by the stack check. While we could
2747 // pause here, the JSFunction didn't have time yet to create and push
2748 // it's context. Instead, we step into the function and pause at the
2749 // first official breakable position.
2750 // This behavior mirrors "BreakOnNextFunctionCall".
2751 if (break_reasons.contains(v8::debug::BreakReason::kScheduled) &&
2752 BreakLocation::IsPausedInJsFunctionEntry(frame)) {
2753 thread_local_.scheduled_break_on_next_function_call_ = true;
2754 PrepareStepIn(function);
2755 return;
2756 }
2757
2758 // Don't stop in builtin and blackboxed functions.
2759 bool ignore_break = ignore_break_mode == kIgnoreIfTopFrameBlackboxed
2760 ? IsBlackboxed(shared)
2761 : AllFramesOnStackAreBlackboxed();
2762 if (ignore_break) return;
2763 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info;
2764 if (ToHandle(isolate_, TryGetDebugInfo(*shared), &debug_info) &&
2765 debug_info->HasBreakInfo()) {
2766 // Enter the debugger.
2767 DebugScope debug_scope(this);
2768
2769 std::vector<BreakLocation> break_locations;
2770 BreakLocation::AllAtCurrentStatement(debug_info, frame,
2771 &break_locations);
2772
2773 for (size_t i = 0; i < break_locations.size(); i++) {
2774 if (IsBreakOnInstrumentation(debug_info, break_locations[i])) {
2775 OnInstrumentationBreak();
2776 break;
2777 }
2778 }
2779
2780 bool has_break_points;
2781 break_points = CheckBreakPointsForLocations(debug_info, break_locations,
2782 &has_break_points);
2783 bool is_muted = has_break_points && break_points.is_null();
2784 // If we get to this point, a break was triggered because e.g. of a
2785 // debugger statement, an assert, .. . However, we do not stop if this
2786 // position "is muted", which happens if a conditional breakpoint at
2787 // this point evaluates to false.
2788 if (is_muted) return;
2789 }
2790 }
2791 }
2792
2793 StepAction lastStepAction = last_step_action();
2794
2795 // Clear stepping to avoid duplicate breaks.
2796 ClearStepping();
2797
2798 DebugScope debug_scope(this);
2799 OnDebugBreak(break_points.is_null() ? isolate_->factory()->empty_fixed_array()
2800 : break_points.ToHandleChecked(),
2801 lastStepAction, break_reasons);
2802}
2803
2804#ifdef DEBUG
2805void Debug::PrintBreakLocation() {
2806 if (!v8_flags.print_break_location) return;
2807 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2808 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
2809 DebuggableStackFrameIterator iterator(isolate_);
2810 if (iterator.done()) return;
2811 CommonFrame* frame = iterator.frame();
2812 std::vector<FrameSummary> frames;
2813 frame->Summarize(&frames);
2814 int inlined_frame_index = static_cast<int>(frames.size() - 1);
2815 FrameInspector inspector(frame, inlined_frame_index, isolate_);
2816 int source_position = inspector.GetSourcePosition();
2817 Handle<Object> script_obj = inspector.GetScript();
2818 PrintF("[debug] break in function '");
2819 inspector.GetFunctionName()->PrintOn(stdout);
2820 PrintF("'.\n");
2821 if (IsScript(*script_obj)) {
2822 Handle<Script> script = Handle<Script>::cast(script_obj);
2823 Handle<String> source(String::cast(script->source()), isolate_);
2824 Script::InitLineEnds(isolate_, script);
2825 Script::PositionInfo info;
2826 Script::GetPositionInfo(script, source_position, &info,
2827 Script::OffsetFlag::kNoOffset);
2828 int line = info.line;
2829 int column = info.column;
2830 Handle<FixedArray> line_ends(FixedArray::cast(script->line_ends()),
2831 isolate_);
2832 int line_start = line == 0 ? 0 : Smi::ToInt(line_ends->get(line - 1)) + 1;
2833 int line_end = Smi::ToInt(line_ends->get(line));
2834 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
2835 String::FlatContent content = source->GetFlatContent(no_gc);
2836 if (content.IsOneByte()) {
2837 PrintF("[debug] %.*s\n", line_end - line_start,
2838 content.ToOneByteVector().begin() + line_start);
2839 PrintF("[debug] ");
2840 for (int i = 0; i < column; i++) PrintF(" ");
2841 PrintF("^\n");
2842 } else {
2843 PrintF("[debug] at line %d column %d\n", line, column);
2844 }
2845 }
2846}
2847#endif // DEBUG
2848
2849DebugScope::DebugScope(Debug* debug)
2850 : debug_(debug),
2851 prev_(reinterpret_cast<DebugScope*>(
2852 base::Relaxed_Load(&debug->thread_local_.current_debug_scope_))),
2853 no_interrupts_(debug_->isolate_) {
2854 timer_.Start();
2855 // Link recursive debugger entry.
2856 base::Relaxed_Store(&debug_->thread_local_.current_debug_scope_,
2857 reinterpret_cast<base::AtomicWord>(this));
2858 // Store the previous frame id and return value.
2859 break_frame_id_ = debug_->break_frame_id();
2860
2861 // Create the new break info. If there is no proper frames there is no break
2862 // frame id.
2863 DebuggableStackFrameIterator it(isolate());
2864 bool has_frames = !it.done();
2865 debug_->thread_local_.break_frame_id_ =
2866 has_frames ? it.frame()->id() : StackFrameId::NO_ID;
2867
2868 debug_->UpdateState();
2869}
2870
2871void DebugScope::set_terminate_on_resume() { terminate_on_resume_ = true; }
2872
2873base::TimeDelta DebugScope::ElapsedTimeSinceCreation() {
2874 return timer_.Elapsed();
2875}
2876
2877DebugScope::~DebugScope() {
2878 // Terminate on resume must have been handled by retrieving it, if this is
2879 // the outer scope.
2880 if (terminate_on_resume_) {
2881 if (!prev_) {
2882 debug_->isolate_->stack_guard()->RequestTerminateExecution();
2883 } else {
2884 prev_->set_terminate_on_resume();
2885 }
2886 }
2887 // Leaving this debugger entry.
2888 base::Relaxed_Store(&debug_->thread_local_.current_debug_scope_,
2889 reinterpret_cast<base::AtomicWord>(prev_));
2890
2891 // Restore to the previous break state.
2892 debug_->thread_local_.break_frame_id_ = break_frame_id_;
2893
2894 debug_->UpdateState();
2895}
2896
2897ReturnValueScope::ReturnValueScope(Debug* debug) : debug_(debug) {
2898 return_value_ = debug_->return_value_handle();
2899}
2900
2901ReturnValueScope::~ReturnValueScope() {
2902 debug_->set_return_value(*return_value_);
2903}
2904
2905void Debug::UpdateDebugInfosForExecutionMode() {
2906 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2907 // Walk all debug infos and update their execution mode if it is different
2908 // from the isolate execution mode.
2909 const DebugInfo::ExecutionMode current_debug_execution_mode =
2910 isolate_->debug_execution_mode();
2911
2912 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
2913 DebugInfoCollection::Iterator it(&debug_infos_);
2914 for (; it.HasNext(); it.Advance()) {
2915 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info(it.Next(), isolate_);
2916 if (debug_info->HasInstrumentedBytecodeArray() &&
2917 debug_info->DebugExecutionMode() != current_debug_execution_mode) {
2918 DCHECK(debug_info->shared()->HasBytecodeArray());
2919 if (current_debug_execution_mode == DebugInfo::kBreakpoints) {
2920 ClearSideEffectChecks(debug_info);
2921 ApplyBreakPoints(debug_info);
2922 } else {
2923 ClearBreakPoints(debug_info);
2924 ApplySideEffectChecks(debug_info);
2925 }
2926 }
2927 }
2928}
2929
2930void Debug::SetTerminateOnResume() {
2931 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2932 DebugScope* scope = reinterpret_cast<DebugScope*>(
2933 base::Acquire_Load(&thread_local_.current_debug_scope_));
2934 CHECK_NOT_NULL(scope);
2935 scope->set_terminate_on_resume();
2936}
2937
2938void Debug::StartSideEffectCheckMode() {
2939 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2940 DCHECK_EQ(isolate_->debug_execution_mode(), DebugInfo::kBreakpoints);
2941 isolate_->set_debug_execution_mode(DebugInfo::kSideEffects);
2942 UpdateHookOnFunctionCall();
2943 side_effect_check_failed_ = false;
2944
2945 DCHECK(!temporary_objects_);
2946 temporary_objects_.reset(new TemporaryObjectsTracker());
2947 isolate_->heap()->AddHeapObjectAllocationTracker(temporary_objects_.get());
2948
2949 Handle<RegExpMatchInfo> current_match_info(
2950 isolate_->native_context()->regexp_last_match_info(), isolate_);
2951 int register_count = current_match_info->number_of_capture_registers();
2952 regexp_match_info_ = RegExpMatchInfo::New(
2953 isolate_, JSRegExp::CaptureCountForRegisters(register_count));
2954 DCHECK_EQ(regexp_match_info_->number_of_capture_registers(),
2955 current_match_info->number_of_capture_registers());
2956 regexp_match_info_->set_last_subject(current_match_info->last_subject());
2957 regexp_match_info_->set_last_input(current_match_info->last_input());
2958 RegExpMatchInfo::CopyElements(isolate_, *regexp_match_info_, 0,
2959 *current_match_info, 0, register_count,
2960 SKIP_WRITE_BARRIER);
2961
2962 // Update debug infos to have correct execution mode.
2963 UpdateDebugInfosForExecutionMode();
2964}
2965
2966void Debug::StopSideEffectCheckMode() {
2967 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2968 DCHECK_EQ(isolate_->debug_execution_mode(), DebugInfo::kSideEffects);
2969 if (side_effect_check_failed_) {
2970 DCHECK(isolate_->has_exception());
2971 DCHECK_IMPLIES(v8_flags.strict_termination_checks,
2972 isolate_->is_execution_terminating());
2973 // Convert the termination exception into a regular exception.
2974 isolate_->CancelTerminateExecution();
2975 isolate_->Throw(*isolate_->factory()->NewEvalError(
2976 MessageTemplate::kNoSideEffectDebugEvaluate));
2977 }
2978 isolate_->set_debug_execution_mode(DebugInfo::kBreakpoints);
2979 UpdateHookOnFunctionCall();
2980 side_effect_check_failed_ = false;
2981
2982 DCHECK(temporary_objects_);
2983 isolate_->heap()->RemoveHeapObjectAllocationTracker(temporary_objects_.get());
2984 temporary_objects_.reset();
2985 isolate_->native_context()->set_regexp_last_match_info(*regexp_match_info_);
2986 regexp_match_info_ = Handle<RegExpMatchInfo>::null();
2987
2988 // Update debug infos to have correct execution mode.
2989 UpdateDebugInfosForExecutionMode();
2990}
2991
2992void Debug::ApplySideEffectChecks(Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info) {
2993 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
2994 DCHECK(debug_info->HasInstrumentedBytecodeArray());
2995 Handle<BytecodeArray> debug_bytecode(debug_info->DebugBytecodeArray(isolate_),
2996 isolate_);
2997 DebugEvaluate::ApplySideEffectChecks(debug_bytecode);
2998 debug_info->SetDebugExecutionMode(DebugInfo::kSideEffects);
2999}
3000
3001void Debug::ClearSideEffectChecks(Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info) {
3002 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
3003 DCHECK(debug_info->HasInstrumentedBytecodeArray());
3004 Handle<BytecodeArray> debug_bytecode(debug_info->DebugBytecodeArray(isolate_),
3005 isolate_);
3006 Handle<BytecodeArray> original(debug_info->OriginalBytecodeArray(isolate_),
3007 isolate_);
3008 for (interpreter::BytecodeArrayIterator it(debug_bytecode); !it.done();
3009 it.Advance()) {
3010 // Restore from original. This may copy only the scaling prefix, which is
3011 // correct, since we patch scaling prefixes to debug breaks if exists.
3012 debug_bytecode->set(it.current_offset(),
3013 original->get(it.current_offset()));
3014 }
3015}
3016
3017bool Debug::PerformSideEffectCheck(Handle<JSFunction> function,
3018 Handle<Object> receiver) {
3019 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
3020 DCHECK_EQ(isolate_->debug_execution_mode(), DebugInfo::kSideEffects);
3021 DisallowJavascriptExecution no_js(isolate_);
3022 IsCompiledScope is_compiled_scope(
3023 function->shared()->is_compiled_scope(isolate_));
3024 if (!function->is_compiled(isolate_) &&
3025 !Compiler::Compile(isolate_, function, Compiler::KEEP_EXCEPTION,
3026 &is_compiled_scope)) {
3027 return false;
3028 }
3029 DCHECK(is_compiled_scope.is_compiled());
3030 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared(function->shared(), isolate_);
3031 Handle<DebugInfo> debug_info = GetOrCreateDebugInfo(shared);
3032 DebugInfo::SideEffectState side_effect_state =
3033 debug_info->GetSideEffectState(isolate_);
3034 switch (side_effect_state) {
3035 case DebugInfo::kHasSideEffects:
3036 if (v8_flags.trace_side_effect_free_debug_evaluate) {
3037 PrintF("[debug-evaluate] Function %s failed side effect check.\n",
3038 function->shared()->DebugNameCStr().get());
3039 }
3040 side_effect_check_failed_ = true;
3041 // Throw an uncatchable termination exception.
3042 isolate_->TerminateExecution();
3043 return false;
3044 case DebugInfo::kRequiresRuntimeChecks: {
3045 if (!shared->HasBytecodeArray()) {
3046 return PerformSideEffectCheckForObject(receiver);
3047 }
3048 // If function has bytecode array then prepare function for debug
3049 // execution to perform runtime side effect checks.
3050 DCHECK(shared->is_compiled());
3051 PrepareFunctionForDebugExecution(shared);
3052 ApplySideEffectChecks(debug_info);
3053 return true;
3054 }
3055 case DebugInfo::kHasNoSideEffect:
3056 return true;
3057 case DebugInfo::kNotComputed:
3058 default:
3059 UNREACHABLE();
3060 }
3061}
3062
3063Handle<Object> Debug::return_value_handle() {
3064 return handle(thread_local_.return_value_, isolate_);
3065}
3066
3067bool Debug::PerformSideEffectCheckForAccessor(
3068 Handle<AccessorInfo> accessor_info, Handle<Object> receiver,
3069 AccessorComponent component) {
3070 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
3071 DCHECK_EQ(isolate_->debug_execution_mode(), DebugInfo::kSideEffects);
3072
3073 // List of allowlisted internal accessors can be found in accessors.h.
3074 SideEffectType side_effect_type =
3075 component == AccessorComponent::ACCESSOR_SETTER
3076 ? accessor_info->setter_side_effect_type()
3077 : accessor_info->getter_side_effect_type();
3078
3079 switch (side_effect_type) {
3080 case SideEffectType::kHasNoSideEffect:
3081 // We do not support setter accessors with no side effects, since
3082 // calling set accessors go through a store bytecode. Store bytecodes
3083 // are considered to cause side effects (to non-temporary objects).
3084 DCHECK_NE(AccessorComponent::ACCESSOR_SETTER, component);
3085 return true;
3086
3087 case SideEffectType::kHasSideEffectToReceiver:
3088 DCHECK(!receiver.is_null());
3089 if (PerformSideEffectCheckForObject(receiver)) return true;
3090 return false;
3091
3092 case SideEffectType::kHasSideEffect:
3093 break;
3094 }
3095 if (v8_flags.trace_side_effect_free_debug_evaluate) {
3096 PrintF("[debug-evaluate] API Callback '");
3097 ShortPrint(accessor_info->name());
3098 PrintF("' may cause side effect.\n");
3099 }
3100
3101 side_effect_check_failed_ = true;
3102 // Throw an uncatchable termination exception.
3103 isolate_->TerminateExecution();
3104 return false;
3105}
3106
3107void Debug::IgnoreSideEffectsOnNextCallTo(
3108 Handle<FunctionTemplateInfo> function) {
3109 DCHECK(function->has_side_effects());
3110 // There must be only one such call handler info.
3111 CHECK(ignore_side_effects_for_function_template_info_.is_null());
3112 ignore_side_effects_for_function_template_info_ = function;
3113}
3114
3115bool Debug::PerformSideEffectCheckForCallback(
3116 Handle<FunctionTemplateInfo> function) {
3117 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
3118 DCHECK_EQ(isolate_->debug_execution_mode(), DebugInfo::kSideEffects);
3119
3120 // If an empty |function| handle is passed here then it means that
3121 // the callback IS side-effectful (see CallApiCallbackWithSideEffects
3122 // builtin).
3123 if (!function.is_null() && !function->has_side_effects()) {
3124 return true;
3125 }
3126 if (!ignore_side_effects_for_function_template_info_.is_null()) {
3127 // If the |ignore_side_effects_for_function_template_info_| is set then
3128 // the next API callback call must be made to this function.
3129 CHECK(ignore_side_effects_for_function_template_info_.is_identical_to(
3130 function));
3131 ignore_side_effects_for_function_template_info_ = {};
3132 return true;
3133 }
3134
3135 if (v8_flags.trace_side_effect_free_debug_evaluate) {
3136 PrintF("[debug-evaluate] FunctionTemplateInfo may cause side effect.\n");
3137 }
3138
3139 side_effect_check_failed_ = true;
3140 // Throw an uncatchable termination exception.
3141 isolate_->TerminateExecution();
3142 return false;
3143}
3144
3145bool Debug::PerformSideEffectCheckForInterceptor(
3146 Handle<InterceptorInfo> interceptor_info) {
3147 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
3148 DCHECK_EQ(isolate_->debug_execution_mode(), DebugInfo::kSideEffects);
3149
3150 // Empty InterceptorInfo represents operations that do produce side effects.
3151 if (!interceptor_info.is_null()) {
3152 if (interceptor_info->has_no_side_effect()) return true;
3153 }
3154 if (v8_flags.trace_side_effect_free_debug_evaluate) {
3155 PrintF("[debug-evaluate] API Interceptor may cause side effect.\n");
3156 }
3157
3158 side_effect_check_failed_ = true;
3159 // Throw an uncatchable termination exception.
3160 isolate_->TerminateExecution();
3161 return false;
3162}
3163
3164bool Debug::PerformSideEffectCheckAtBytecode(InterpretedFrame* frame) {
3165 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
3166 using interpreter::Bytecode;
3167
3168 DCHECK_EQ(isolate_->debug_execution_mode(), DebugInfo::kSideEffects);
3169 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> shared = frame->function()->shared();
3170 Tagged<BytecodeArray> bytecode_array = shared->GetBytecodeArray(isolate_);
3171 int offset = frame->GetBytecodeOffset();
3172 interpreter::BytecodeArrayIterator bytecode_iterator(
3173 handle(bytecode_array, isolate_), offset);
3174
3175 Bytecode bytecode = bytecode_iterator.current_bytecode();
3176 if (interpreter::Bytecodes::IsCallRuntime(bytecode)) {
3177 auto id = (bytecode == Bytecode::kInvokeIntrinsic)
3178 ? bytecode_iterator.GetIntrinsicIdOperand(0)
3179 : bytecode_iterator.GetRuntimeIdOperand(0);
3180 if (DebugEvaluate::IsSideEffectFreeIntrinsic(id)) {
3181 return true;
3182 }
3183 side_effect_check_failed_ = true;
3184 // Throw an uncatchable termination exception.
3185 isolate_->TerminateExecution();
3186 return false;
3187 }
3188 interpreter::Register reg;
3189 switch (bytecode) {
3190 case Bytecode::kStaCurrentContextSlot:
3191 reg = interpreter::Register::current_context();
3192 break;
3193 default:
3194 reg = bytecode_iterator.GetRegisterOperand(0);
3195 break;
3196 }
3197 Handle<Object> object =
3198 handle(frame->ReadInterpreterRegister(reg.index()), isolate_);
3199 return PerformSideEffectCheckForObject(object);
3200}
3201
3202bool Debug::PerformSideEffectCheckForObject(Handle<Object> object) {
3203 RCS_SCOPE(isolate_, RuntimeCallCounterId::kDebugger);
3204 DCHECK_EQ(isolate_->debug_execution_mode(), DebugInfo::kSideEffects);
3205
3206 // We expect no side-effects for primitives.
3207 if (IsNumber(*object)) return true;
3208 if (IsName(*object)) return true;
3209
3210 if (temporary_objects_->HasObject(Handle<HeapObject>::cast(object))) {
3211 return true;
3212 }
3213
3214 if (v8_flags.trace_side_effect_free_debug_evaluate) {
3215 PrintF("[debug-evaluate] failed runtime side effect check.\n");
3216 }
3217 side_effect_check_failed_ = true;
3218 // Throw an uncatchable termination exception.
3219 isolate_->TerminateExecution();
3220 return false;
3221}
3222
3223void Debug::SetTemporaryObjectTrackingDisabled(bool disabled) {
3224 if (temporary_objects_) {
3225 temporary_objects_->disabled = disabled;
3226 }
3227}
3228
3229bool Debug::GetTemporaryObjectTrackingDisabled() const {
3230 if (temporary_objects_) {
3231 return temporary_objects_->disabled;
3232 }
3233 return false;
3234}
3235
3236void Debug::PrepareRestartFrame(JavaScriptFrame* frame,
3237 int inlined_frame_index) {
3238 if (frame->is_optimized()) Deoptimizer::DeoptimizeFunction(frame->function());
3239
3240 thread_local_.restart_frame_id_ = frame->id();
3241 thread_local_.restart_inline_frame_index_ = inlined_frame_index;
3242
3243 // TODO(crbug.com/1303521): A full "StepInto" is probably not needed. Get the
3244 // necessary bits out of PrepareSTep into a separate method or fold them
3245 // into Debug::PrepareRestartFrame.
3246 PrepareStep(StepInto);
3247}

3249void Debug::NotifyDebuggerPausedEventSent() {
3250 DebugScope* scope = reinterpret_cast<DebugScope*>(
3251 base::Relaxed_Load(&thread_local_.current_debug_scope_));
3252 CHECK(scope);
3253 isolate_->counters()->debug_pause_to_paused_event()->AddTimedSample(
3254 scope->ElapsedTimeSinceCreation());
3255}
